Reviews.Title: “Central Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: bclockie
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel in Sultan met,handy to every thing, yet very quiet.Wonderful people and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast, hospitality. Rooms a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: mtd23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for the money. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast spread is lovely. You are also given a free turkish coffee on your first night, and it's lovely to drink this from the roof-top dining area. The location can't be beat as you are within walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and all places within Sultanhamet. Our room was a bit on the small side, but this is the norm for Istanbul. Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel in Sultanahment - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lacepede
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this 14 room family run hotel located within walking distance of many of the historic attractions located in the Sultanahmet district. Our room was clean, comfortable bed, room airconditioner, flat screen TV and ensuite bathroom. The top floor had a huge verandah with views over the Bosphorus, comfortable lounge chairs and several computers for use by guests. Breakfast is served on the verandah. The metro train station is 5 minutes walk and the light rail is less than 10 minutes. The walk to transport is along streets with historic mosques, old buildings etc which have never made it to the Travel Guide Books. We enjoyed our stay, staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: ScottO72
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul as part of our honeymoon in Summer 2011, and couldn't have been more pleased. We stayed there on the recommendation of a friend, and we were so glad we did. The location of the hotel is perfect - right in the area of the city where all the major sights are located, within walking distance. The breakfast is INCREDIBLE! It's the most amazing spread of food to choose from - the best breakfast you could even imagine, served on a beautiful rooftop with a gorgeous view. And the staff was top-notch in every way! They were so helpful and supportive, and two of the front desk staff really became friends (a special thanks to the incredible Serkan). They even let us store a bag there for free, filled with all our souvenirs, as we traveled around Turkey for another week and a half, and we picked it up there on our last day back in Istanbul before flying out. I can't this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: bronwenfb
Reviews.Content: If you are like me and care more about the city than the hotel, then Sebnem is perfect for you. Not to say the hotel wasn't great- it was fab - but the location and helpfulness of the staff were even better. The rooms were comfortable, quaint and you really felt like you were in Turkey (not like those sterile international chains). The breakfast was delicious and generous; the location was perfect and the staff were worth their weight in gold. I'd definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moirnh
Reviews.Content: I agree with so many of the other reviewers. I just finished 2 nights at the Sebnem. Great location, great staff, great lounge. In the Sultanahmet, it is a short walk up hill to the major sights. The street has many restaurants to choose from. Our room was the family room with a double bed and 2 single beds. Great sheets and duvet. Immaculate bathroom. The lounge on the top floor serves a good breakfast and you can have drinks as well. A lovely terrace overlooks the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: KimandJay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 seperate occasions for about 4 nights each time in December 2011. Before we arrived the guys on reception were great - helpful and informative via email, and then when we arrived we even more helpful with recommending restaurants, tourist sites, out of the way great experiences and providing information like maps, booklets etc. There were umbrellas in the lobby for guest use (particularly helpful in winter as it rains a lot), free wifi and computer terminals. The location is great, just off one of the larger streets in the areas, beautiful cobblestones lanes, lose to hagia Sofia, blue mosque and topkapi palace. Breakfast is brilliant - full buffet with savory options as well as a huge variety of sweets, cakes, pastries with jams etc. Freshly squeezed juices were a real plus, as well as great Turkish coffee. Breakfast served in the covered rooftop terrace, which I can imagine would be great in the summertime, with a great view over the bosphoros. We stayed both times in the garden room, very quiet, cleaned very well, comfy bed, a slight bit too warm in winter but we sorted this out pretty quickly, nice little touches in the room like fresh water jugs everyday and travel guides in the room, book exchange in the little lobby and for the money we paid, it was clearly the best hotel in a lot of Europe. Would definitely request this place again, and would recommend it o our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, overall great place”
Reviews.Author: C O
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sebnem Hotel over the winter break, and it was so fabulous that we cancelled a later reservation elsewhere in Istanbul and went back to the Sebnem. The staff is wonderful - very friendly and helpful but not pushy. Having visited two other hotels in Turkey (one quite cheap, the other higher-end than Sebnem) I can tell you it's a common problem to find hotel staff who are aggressive in pushing their favored restaurants/tours/etc. No such issue at Sebnem - hotel staff provided recommendations on request, but it was never a hard sell. They were wonderfully welcoming, friendly, and helpful in every respect. Sebnem also has a great location very close to the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, and the metro and light rail lines, the place is clean and comfortable, and the rooftop terrace is wonderful. I was a little worried travelling in the winter that we'd miss this part of the experience, but they have a lovely glass-enclosed indoor space as well as an outdoor terrace - it's a great place to hang out in the evenings particularly as they provide a couple laptops for guests who didn't bring a computer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Megsie123
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Small and quaint with friendly and helpful staff. In the old town of Istanbul. We stayed in a garden room with a beautiful little garden with a daybed and pillows etc. Home cooked breakfast provided with a good buffet selection. Fantastic location for sightseeing and in the middle of heaps of restaurants. Free computer with internet service provided. Will definitely stay here again if we are ever here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: cej18
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and knowledgeable staff; very comfortable canopied bed with red, hand- embroidered canopy; 4 plush pillows and goose-down quilt; immaculately clean; strong, hot showers; and fabulous buffet breakfast with Bosphorus views. Wonderful, central old town location and steps away from 4 streets of excellent, reasonably priced restaurants. Free Wi-fi and Net access. The breakfast is amazing, particularly the fresh-squeezed juice which tasted a little different each day, depending on the available fruits. You don't expect good showers in a budget hotel, but Sebnem provided them. The bed was so comfortable (& I was in 2 different rooms), I felt as though I were at home. This hotel is a true find. They provide little extras to make you feel welcome and comfortable. I plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rs695
Reviews.Content: We read all the fabulous reviews before we booked and Sebnem met our sky high expectations. Rooms are simple and small, but hardly claustrophobic, and very clean. Breakfast food was plentiful, with lots of variety, most of it very good. The terrace is a terrific place to drink morning coffee or tea and plan your day. Location is great, within easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Room rates are very reasonable--Consider that the Four Seasons Istanbul is barely a block away, and other than maybe a larger room, it's got nothing on this place. Finally, the staff here make this otherwise 4-star a 5: They're super helpful with luggage, directions and all the other usual niceities. When I came down with food poisoning (definitely avoid the kebap plate at Pudding Shop!), one of the kitchen staff went out of his way to bring me a warm hydrating tea and ice when I could barely muster the energy to even talk. Everyone took a turn to check in and ask if I needed anything. Very much appreciated this!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: welshbeastie
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms here for two nights and the hotel was a fantastic choice. Very central in the old town but that can be said of hundreds of similar small hotels. What made this a great choice was: - clean and tastefully designed bedrooms, there was a quirky style, with a modern bathroom. One of the rooms was smaller but adequate for a city break, the other was larger with a four poster and another bed. - the lounge / breakfast terrace was accessible all day and the staff were welcoming any time of day, Mr Cappuccino man was very warm and funny. With an inside and outside area we could not have asked for more. The Wifi was slick. - the breakfast was great. Only a small selection on the savoury buffet but this was ample and good quality. The bread and cake section was excellent with most being made freshly each day. The coffee was excellent with a choice not dissimilar from a cafe and there was a wide selection of teas. Would not hesitate to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nagel
Reviews.Content: We began our trip in Turkey by staying in the Sultanahmet area at the Sebnem Hotel. They arranged transportation from the airport for us which went well. This is in a great location on a quiet dead-end street close to many restaurants and within easy walking distance to the Hagia Sophia and the tram line. Our room was small but clean and the bathroom was very functional with full-time hot water. The breakfast buffet was excellent and served on the top floor with an amazing view over the water. I was a bit chilly but during warmer weather it would be a great place to dine outside. The staff was exceptional and everyone spoke great english. They were very helpful and full of excellent recommendations. Late one evening, I was having problems getting on line (they have 3 laptops available for use) and two of the staff sat with me and offered assistance on how to use the Turkish keyboard and set up a new Google account. I would recommend this hotel due to the location and the amazing staff who made our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gwaladar
Reviews.Content: My choice of the Sebnem Hotel is a result of relying on TripAdvisor. And now, after my stay, in October, I can confirm that it was an excellent choice. To put it in other words: all reviews I had read about this hotel turned out to be right. I had been in Istanbul in 2009 and I had already identified the area where I wanted to sleep next time I came. Fortunately the Sebnem Hotel is located in this area, very close to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern. A little further away but still easy to reach by foot are -to the West- the Grand Bazaar, the Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ Turkish baths, the University of Istanbul and several mosques like the big SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque; and to the North, i.e. down to the harbour, the GÃ¼lhane Park, the main train station (in one of its rooms, in the evening, it is possible to see a Sema ceremony with whirling Dervishes), the Hodjapasha Cultural Center (this is another place where it is possible to see a Sema ceremony with whirling Dervishes â€“no pictures allowed), the Spice Bazaar, the Yeni Mosque and the Galata Bridge. In additon to all these tourist attractions, the small street of this hotel is very quiet because cars cannot drive through it. So the location is great (and obviously, there are many, many restaurants all around). With reference to the hotel, this is not a high building at all, as it has just a ground floor and two other floors. It does not have either many rooms (at least I didnâ€™t see many, just a handful), which means that the atmosphere is also quiet, relaxed and pleasant. The tiled floor of the common areas like reception, the stairs, the corridors and the breakfast terrace is very clean. The rooms are also very, very clean. Our room (I say â€œourâ€� because I came with my father) had a cosy wooden floor and everything was spotless. Iâ€™ll try to attach the pictures I took so that readers can see it. We found it very comfortable, well equipped, spacious enough and we enjoyed a very good sleep quality. About the view, well..., from our room (#16) we could only see the street but room #18 does have a partial view out to the Marmara Sea. However, if you climb to the partially glass covered roof terrace where breakfast is served, you will enjoy a good view over the sea. It is also here where they have a couple of laptops that guests can use for free to access internet (next to the reception they also have a PC with access to internet). Talking about the roof terrace let me mention that one of the reasons to choose this hotel was the good reports I read about the breakfast, a subject which I consider crucial. Happily for my stomach, the reports were right, as you can see in the 2 attached pictures of the breakfast buffet that my father took. Let me just add that together with the breakfast, they serve you a jug with a delicious mix of fruit juices which seems to be responsibility of a very polite man that prepares it and brings it to your table. By the way, the rest of the staff like Cesar, Serkan and the others (sorry for not remembering all names) were always very nice and very helpful. They are a great crew. And well..., these are my impressions which I hope will help other readers to choose a place to sleep. From my side I just hope to stay again some day at this cosy hotel (but not in October, as the weather was cloudy and rainy. Apparently May and June are the best months to visit Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandie-NY
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at the Sebnem in 2010 but I waited too long to book. This year I booked early for a garden room, but waited too long to book for the first part and had a regular double. The double was nice with wood floors, flat screen and good free wifi. However, I will be sorry I wrote this review when I am unable to book the garden room. It was amazing! In addition to the above, there was a small garden with a table and chairs and a leather couch under cover with an overhead heater. (This was mid October which was unusually cold and rainy). I will book this room for next year. Yes, some of the bathrooms are small, but they are impeccably clean as are the rooms. The staff is very accommodating I had organized a group of 6 friends and friends of friends to travel. Part of the group was running in the Istanbul Marathon races. We needed to be at the buses by 7:15am. Breakfast started at 8AM, but the staff had coffee for us at 6:30am on race day. The location is perfect. Walking distance to the Blue Mosque and off the main street with restaurants for all budgets and taste. The upstairs terrace has inside and outside facing the sea. During the rainy days, it was cozy and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “10 euros more, it's worth”
Reviews.Author: beatmea
Reviews.Content: Sebnem Hotel, in Sultanahmet it is probably one of the best choice. 10 euros more expensive than the similar rest, it is worth going: confortable rooms (bed but especially there's enough room to talk and breath. Similar hotels, even closer to Sebnem, cost 10 euros less, but no way to walk in your room). ROOMS Clean and nice. Good taste furnished. The one we got had no particular view. Bathroom is ok. Clean and wide. No window. BREAKFAST A lot and various. Similar hotels, even closer to Sebnem, give you a depressing choice. Here is delicious and fresh (cake and fruit). 10 euros more, it is worth. TERRACE Beautiful, on the sea. Look like a Turkish Budda Bar. Can go there at any time till midnight to have a drink. MANAGER AND WAITERS Beautiful people. 10 euros more, it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmerbellum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sebnem on three occasions now and will definitely be back if ever we are in Istanbul again. A delightful small hotel with lovely rooms, the best breakfast, lovely staff and a fabulous location. What more could you want? It's in a quiet street just seconds from the Sultanahmet restaurant strip, has a gorgeous roof terrace with views of the Sea of Marmara, comfy seating both covered and outdoor, three laptops plus wifi available. Our absolute favourities are the two garden rooms - book one if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly B
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get 7 contiguous nights at this hotel for my entire stay in Istanbul. The staff was absolutely wonderful. Helpful and friendly and so sweet with other guests' small children. I enjoyed hanging out on the upstairs terrace, which was enclosed and cozy warm on blustery days. The room was a great size, kept very clean, and was quiet. The bed and duvet were fantastically comfortable. Breakfasts were great and the variety of pastries was amazing. Wonderful place to have as home base while away from home. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: govinda8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sebnem back in July 2010, and now that I'm back in Istanbul and not staying there I'm so bummed! They have the best breakfasts, and I dream about the bowls of fresh cherries they'd set out. The rooms are small and can be a bit noisy, but I'd take it in a second with the view from their terrace. The staff are very friendly, and it was a small and pleasant refuge from the cruise ship hordes and summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: tolarjev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 hotels in this part of Istanbul (Sebnem (best), Asmali (worst), Dara (almost as good as Sebnem)). This hotel is in a great neighborhood which is brimming with restaurants & is easy to find. The hotel staff were as helpful as they could be. Were sent here by Haci at Magic Valley Tours, & he booked most of our rooms in Istanbul & Cappadocia. Would recommend Haci too - very professional & trustworthy. Anyway, all good about the hotel: cheerful room, completely clean, nice rooftop restaurant for breakfast. Laptops available for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted we picked Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: Maureen F
Reviews.Content: We were all delighted to have picked Sebnem Hotel for our stay in Istanbul. It was the perfect place for our party of nine, who had come to Turkey from four different parts of the world for a re-union of friends. The rooms were spotless, the staff are friendly and helpful, the rooftop terrace was fabulous, for gatherings during the day and evening, for quiet reads if no one else was around, and especially for a fabulous breakfast. For a change from the local restaurants, you can ask for the rooftop evening BBQ, the staff go to great effort for this event, and it is lovely watching the sunset over the Golden Horn and Sea of Marmara while dinner is being cooked on the terrace. The hotelâ€™s location makes for easy walking access to the main attractions in the Sultanahmet. The tramway is also easily accessed if one did not want a longer walk to the Grand Bazaar and other attractions slightly further away. Serkan and Sezer, the excellent managers, provided help and advice for trips further a field, and in one case saved us from a useless trip across the water to the Florence Nightingale Museum that was closed for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Sebnem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crazyonroute
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 3 children (12, 10, 9) the first week of August. Incredible location, very close to the main attractions of Sultanahmet and the sea. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms, although small, are clean and comfortable. Its location just a few steps away from a busy street with a wide selection of restaurants is very convenient but quiet at the same time.The breakfast terrance on the top floor overlooking the Marmara Sea and the Bosphorus is extremely nice. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found the Sebnem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paisleylass1701
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebnem Hotel for 4 nights (19th - 23rd August). The Hotel is in an excellent position in Sultanahmet. Major attractions including Ayia Sofia, Blue Mosque,Arasta Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, are all within walking distance. The Hotel is in a quiet residential street with bars and restaurants 100 metres around the corner. Our room was one of the pretty garden rooms on the ground floor which was very clean and comfortable. On arrival we were warmly welcomed by the Reception Manager, Serkan, who gave us lots of information on Istanbul. The Hotel also has 4 laptops with free internet access. Breakfast is served on the Rooftop Terrace with gorgeous views of the Bosphorus and what a breakfast it was. Jugs of freshly squeezed organge juice, freshly brewed cappuchino's or latte's, cereals, cold meats, cheese, eggs, salad, all kinds of fresh fruits, freshly baked pastries and cakes. Metin (Mr Marmaris) who served breakfast and drinks on the Rooftop Terrace was amazing, such a nice gentleman and always friendly and attentive, as were all the staff there. Serkan and Sezer on Reception were always so friendly and helpful with great knowledge of the city of Istanbul and I now consider them to be friends. I'll always keep unforgettable memories of the Sebnem and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem is an incredible find”
Reviews.Author: liscalabrese
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 9 day vacation in Istanbul I stayed at the Sebnem and it was wonderful. They arrainged the transportation from the airport and the driver was there to meet me right on time. I felt at home as soon as I walked in. The staff is friendly and attentive and always asking if you need anything. The rooms are spotless and cleaned perfectly daily. The location is great walking distance to all the major sightseeing and wonderful restaurants yet in its own little corner so you are not bothered by the noise on the busy street. The terrace is amazing the view will take your breath away and the breakfast is great freshly squeezed orange juice and so much more. I cant wait to go back. Istanbul is beautiful and Sebnem is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: tripjunky
Reviews.Content: The Sebnem Hotel was the perfect place for us to stay during our visit to this enchanting city. The hotel is very clean with a friendly, professional and knowledgeable staff. The location is excellent. It is a short walk to Aya Sofia and all the tourist destinations near it. The street adjacent to the hotel has everything a traveler needs; shops, restaurants, laundry etc. The room had simple yet nice decor and all the conveniences we needed. However, we paid extra for a 'Sea View' room and frankly the 'view' was not worth the extra money. The breakfast was the best! everything was great and they made your coffee fresh and the orange juice was fresh squeezed. Add to that the incredible view of the sea from the breakfast terrace and it was definitely the perfect way to start each day. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcstlouis
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, excellent service. The breakfast is amazing, plenty of choices. The hotel has a terrace overlooking the Bosphorus. Great location to visit the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with a friendly atmosphere & amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LeapingLizz
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Sebnem Hotel, Istanbul for 3 nights. The Hotel is in a great position in Sultanahmet. Major attractions are within close walking distance.. AyaSofya, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Arasta Bazaar etc (we also walked to Spice Markets & Grand Bazaar) - also restaurants are within 100 mtrs! We were warmly welcomed by the staff & given complimentary Latte Coffees on arrival. Our room was clean & comfortable (I loved my comfy bed & the luxurious large pillows) - some reviews mention the rooms are on the small side, but when we were in Istanbul we didn't have much time to spend it in your room, so this didn't worry us - in fact we travelled for 5 wks through Europe/Turkey & we found the room to be larger than many... the Rooftop Terrace certainly is of a large size with indoor or outdoor seating & great views of the Bosphorus Sea. The Hotel has 4 laptops with free internet. Breakfast is served on the Rooftop Terrace - I felt the breakfast served was suitable for a King (or Queen!) Freshly squeezed juice was served each morning (to our table by Mr Mertin) , along with freshly brewed Latte's or Cappucino's. The staff on the Rooftop were amazing - always friendly & attentive. Sira is a fantastic cook - her delicious assortment of pastries & cakes tempted everyones tastebuds. Reception staff were always very helpful, with great knowledge of the City. We had a very enjoyable time at the Sebnem and I would definately stay here if I return. Thankyou to Serkon & Sezer who explained the game of Backgammon - next visit I will bring some good luck dice :) (fresh filtered water is also avail 24hrs day..in the lobby and on the rooftop)

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return”
Reviews.Author: 7nico
Reviews.Content: I came to Sebnem hotel with family (2 adults, one children) seven days in June and July. From first to last day, I did not regretted a single second this choice. Brilliant location, very close to Istanbulâ€™s must (Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace). Walking distance from Grand Bazaar. For visits further away, the tram is not far away. And if we choose taxi, they arrived at the hotel after only three minutes. Sebnem is a peaceful, friendly and really cool hotel. You feel at home. The rooms are really nice, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is the best we ate during our three week stay in Turkey. The roof terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea is beautiful. It is open all day long (drinks, internet, newspapers,...). But also, the front desk staff is fantastic. Thank you Sezer and Serkan! When we needed your help for information or service you have always been present. We feel that everyone appreciated your kindness. I keep an unforgettable memory of my stay. I recommend this hotel to travelers looking for a simple and friendly small hotel, without artifice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: autlisadeu
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay in Sebnem. The room was clean and simple/comfortable. The staff were unbelievable at reception. They were very well informed. Also, the location was very nice. The breakfast was superb!. By the way, I want to say special thanks to Metin and all on the terrace. To sum: Everything was amazing! Thanks for all Sebnem Team. We'll come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finnish_Medley
Reviews.Content: I preferred Sebnem because of their excellent breakfast. You may find many kinds of cakes,boreks,cookies and so on. But the best point was daily fresh squeezed orange juice.. And I have got to say that Serkan and Sezer at front desk were incredible. They were very friendly and helpful. They were both so eager to answer many questions of me. And hotel's location was perfect. Hagia sophia, blue mosque and topkapi palace are in walking distance. Don't hesitate to stay here.I Look forward to my next visit already.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views from peaceful terrace”
Reviews.Author: portermonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, overall a fair experience. The beds and pillows were not very comfortable though, which proved to be true throughout turkey. The terrace is wonderful, great views, breezy, filled with couches, pillows, and soft Turkish music. Very good breakfast as well, and they packed some for our early morning departure. They arranged a taxi to and from the airport for 25 euros, each way, which is higher than the 20 euros at other hotels. It walking distance to most of the tourist attractions Ask for a room away from the kitchen, or you will hear the noise early in the morning. They even had a drawer full of chargers so we could charge our iPad.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: pottery78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sebnem with my friends and we all did enjoyed. Everything was amazing. Young reception staff was so kind and helpful. When you first check in at the hotel, you will see their smiling faces. The breakfast was so impressive that i couldn't find a word which could define it. The rooms are also very clean. The hotel organised a BBQ party as well during our stay. It was delicious..mmm And the location was perfect. Many important structures can be visited by walking. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MJT1968
Reviews.Content: My daughter, a friend and I stayed in the Sebnem (family room) in October 2010. The hotel was comfortable, clean, and very convenient. We found the staff to be very helpful. Their English was excellent and they were most helpful with information and assistance. We requested airport transportation and it was waiting for us when we cleared Turkish immigration/entrance protocols. My daughter and I arrived before noon, so the room was not yet ready. They offered us a snack on the rooftop, even though breakfast was long over, and let us relax there until our room was ready, which was sooner than the promised check-in time. On the subsequent days of our stay, the breakfast on the rooftop was excellent. The location is perfect for seeing Sultanamet and the immediate area offers a wealth of restaurants and shops. In summary, the Sebnem was a real bargain and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have made a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: kerrmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sebnem Hotel for 3 nights. Our room was so well equipped and quiet. The staff was very well trained and attentive to individuals needs. The location made me very suprised! You can walk everywhere just a few minutes! Finally; I really loved the breakfast. It was amazing! We couldn't have made a better choice.Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, little guesthouse in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: kmfalch
Reviews.Content: First of all, we had ordered (by e-mailing the hotel) shuttle service from Ataturk Airport the day of arrival. Just a few minutes waiting, and we had our own nice car with trusted driver. We even got fresh water in the taxi, that is a pluss. The service was excellent so we did the same the day we went home. Arrive upon hotel was just very nice. Friendly handshakes and big smiles! We had seaview room (nr. 18). Nice Bosphorus view. Not stunning view, but you can see the river behind neighbour roof tops. Very small room and bathroom but clean and spotless. Queen size bed. Not the best sleep quality (a street just outside with some noisy cars working in the night and also lot of cats making noise in the street). Location is perfect. Sultanahmed is a great place to stay. Small streets, lovely houses, close to the biggest attractions (5 minutes to Aya Sofia) and to restaurats and bars, but choose the restaurants carefully because i think there are a lot of tourist traps nearby. But we had only nice dinners everywhere we went. The best thing with the hotel is the terrace. Having breakfast (very good by the way, but a bit too much cakes) in the sun, a glass of wine before you go out for dinner or just surfing the internet on one of the laptops for free. Not mutch negative things to say about this place. The only thing is that the room was a bit smaal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: nicholas_CA
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience in Istanbul. Hotel was really, really good. The location is perfect. Breakfast was excellent and the staff was incredible. You can always see their smiling face. And Metin on terrace was amazing!! We loved different kinds of tea that he prepared for us. Shortly, everything was perfect except the weather. We've hardly ever seen the sun. We'd love to come back to this hidden gem on better season to enjoy Istanbul. Teshekkurler Sebnem Team!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: roula_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best one my husband and I have ever stayed in, for a few reasons. 1) great location, in central Sulnatahment and walking distance to all the major sights like Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc. 2) wonderful clean rooms with all the amenities we needed and a wonderful, yummy breakfast and lovely rooftop terrace. 3) Good value. 4) the staff members were incredible. In fact they were the best part of our stay! They were so friendly and helpful we even went back to visit them in Istanbul a week after we checked out! They went out of their way for us, and made us feel at home from day one! We even added them as our friends on Facebook! We would go back in a heartbeat next time we're in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Staff and location made the trip even better”
Reviews.Author: TexasJerseygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable and very eager to please. Fresh juice in the morning, fresh salads at breakfast started the day off right. View from the terrace is terrific. Books available to borrow if you have time to read. Always felt as though I was coming home. Their reccomendations for places to eat and directions to the different places we wanted to go were excellent. They will also teach you a little Turkish if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RomanoLuca
Reviews.Content: It was our first experience in Istanbol and we've never been regretful for prefering this hotel. We spent 4 great days at Hotel Sebnem and it was very comfortable. We stayed in the garden room for the first three nights and in sea view room for last night. The rooms were very comfy and cleaned everyday. However, the best thing at this hotel was breakfast ( fresh squeezed juice and any kinds of cakes) and the staff at reception. Especially, Serkan and Sezar was excellent!! They are both young and so dynamic..They were very lovely, friendly and the most importantly helpful. We went many places with their excellent recommendations..It was a great convenience.. And if we come back to Istanbul again, we would definitely love to stay at hotel Sebnem. It wouldn't be better..Highly recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madkitty2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebnem for 2 nights. Arrived after a fantastic transfer through Istanbul Airport Shuttle (incredible service). The hotel was nice but I must admit I expected more after all the good reviews. The location cant be beaten at all - its 1 min walk to Topkapi about 3 mins to Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque and as soon as you walk out of the door you have about 20+ restaurants scattered around so it was a very safe place to stay. The room was rather small but amazingly clean, unfortunately though beds were not the comfiest I had slept in - be warned also that due to the incredibly close location to the mosque you will get woken at 5am (not the hotels fault by any means LOL). The breakfast was very disappointing for me, yes it was cold buffet style but there seemed to be too many cakes rather than cold meats which I must admit Im not a big fan of cake at 8am., however the freshly squashed juice is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, clean, superb breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: chrisjmthornton
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Quiet (just off street). Very clost to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, restaurants, tram, etc. Room clean and well serviced. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast fantastic. Beautiful terrace for breakfast or any time during the day (newspapers, books, wifi, often free tea and fruit ...) overlooking the sea. Highly recommended. Stayed in family room, perfect for 4.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - warm staff and best breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: vickymorris81
Reviews.Content: We stayed for over 1 week at Hotel Sebnem and it made our Istanbul experience that much better. The staff were all exceptionally warm and friendly. Breakfast is an absolute highlight - so much variety, and it may be the best we've seen. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mick038
Reviews.Content: Excellent value , prime position near Blue Mosque , fantastic views, modern clean rooms ,everything worked { miracle in mid east } very attentive staff , great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabraham
Reviews.Content: We loved the Sebnem, for it's friendly staff, superb breakfasts, and convenience for seeing sights in old Istanbul. Rooms aren't large, but are quite charming. The only problem (general to the area) is noise from evening partyers in the neighborhood, but if you come prepared you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great in the area and good coffee”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSusan
Reviews.Content: Once you've been in Turkey more than a couple of days, you notice that the coffee choice is Turkish coffee (not everyone's cup of tea!) or Nescafe. Not so at the Sebnem Hotel! 1. The staff here is really lovely. 2. Airport pick-up and drop-off excellent. 3. Breakfast was THE best by far of our two weeks in Turkey. 4. Location: 5 minutes from Aya Sofia, Arasta Bazaar & Blue Mosque. (once you find the way!) 5. Roof-Top terrace MOST WONDERFUL and...6. Cafe Latte for breakfast (included in breakfast/room price...No extra charge). Yes, rooms are small but clean, beds are comfortable, bathroom totally adequate...and, let's face it...you're in Istanbul and all you do in your room is sleep. When we wanted to relax a bit, we went to the roof terrace where not only is the view wonderful, there are very comfortable divans as well as chairs to relax on and stretch out and it was never crowded up there. There were staff in the roof terrace area at all hours so we could always get a beer or a latte.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staffs.. Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SeongTeng
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in the hotel although i wish to, but due to is fully booked. It started with the front desk staff made a mistake on telling me there is an room available for me for one night, and found a hotel just opposite theirs for my second night. However, i couldnt stay there as it's fully booked, and to compensate for their mistake, they offered me to use their hotel facilities/breakfast, during my stay in Istanbul, and also free transport from/to airport, helping us to carry our luggage to the car. I arrived in Istanbul 6 hours before my wife, and as promised, they provided me transport from airport, and they offered me to take a rest at their terrace indoor cafe, and turning on the heater for me, before my wife arrival. Then, they called the transport to take me to the airport to pick up my wife, and sent us to the hotel just opposite theirs. i felt pampered with this kinda service they offered, and they even let me use their common PC for my Email.. i couldnt give a review bout room, as i was not staying in their hotel, but i believe with their services that they offered to me, it must be very high quality. Location wise, this is the best location to stay if u are visiting istanbul for leisure, walking distance to all the attractions, and Trem station. and Sultanahmet area itself is very convenient for tourist.. and they have really nice terrace cafe, indoor/outdoor facing the sea. Thanks Hotel Sebnem for all the help provided!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely staff, the best breakfasts, good decor but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: gabriel0897
Reviews.Content: On first checking in I was a bit disappointed as the promised sea view for which I paid extra was actually obscured by the building opposite and alot of laundry drying. The room was so tiny that one wouldn't want to spend any time in it to admire the view anyway, even if there was a chair to sit in for the purpose, which there wasn't! However, I was mollified by the charm of the young staff at the desk who were so helpful and friendly, by the very well furnished and comfortable terrace upstairs and the excellent breakfasts. Freshly squeezed fruit juice is definitely not the norm in Istanbul hotels of this class. Mind you, you are paying slightly more here - on a small cul-de-sac with at least 3 other similar hotels, this was easily the most expensive. (I've stayed in three of them.) But it also buys you simple and tasteful decoration, and more generous public space than some others. On the "sea view" side, the nights were disturbed by very noisy rubbish collection twice in the four days we were there - at either an extremely late or very early hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull !!”
Reviews.Author: hakan047
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on internet. Was a little bit careful, I have seen hotels in Istanbul before. This one is amazing. Nice small family hotel with kind and honest personel. They even found and gave back my expensive golden chain! Very nice breakfast with fresh products. Murat the manager took us for a free city tour and even paid us a lunch ! Nice romantic rooms with comfortable beds. We will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a second!”
Reviews.Author: MrBeardy
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Sebnem hotel was the quality of service from the people at the front desk. They were always smiling and happy to answer all our questions about where to go and what to see and do in Istanbul. Breakfasts at Sebnem were better than any other place we stayed in Turkey. The variety and abundance of pastries was amazing. Fresh squeezed OJ, omelettes made to order, etc. If ever we find ourselves in Istanbul again we will definitely stay at Sebnem.

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better for the price - great facility, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: citroenbill
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet has so many choices for hotels it can be overwhelming trying to decide, but be assured, Hotel Sebnem will meet you needs and please you. Great location (near the 4 Seasons) behind Topkapi, within walking distance of everything. Rooms are lovely and spacious by Istanbul standards. Beautiful roof garden with indoor and outdoor seating. Probably the best (included) breakfast of any hotel I've had in Turkey. Staff is traditionally pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very clean, modern baths, wifi and flat screen TVs. For the price, you really can save yourself some time looking at 50 hotels and trying to decide which one is right for you and stay here. The only limitation I can think of is that there is no elevator access to the roof garden/breakfast room, so mobility limited guests may find it unacceptable. Otherwise stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: baliboy_10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel not so much because of its remarkably reasonable rates, but because of the consistently good reviews - particularly in regard to the friendly staff. We were not disapointed. The hotel is in a fantastic location, only a 100 metres from the walls of the Topkapi Palace and close to the main sights of Sultanahmet. The nearby streets are lively and fun and house many restaurants one of which, Aloran, became a real favourite. We knew that we would need to change rooms during our stay of 6 nights and this gave us a chance to check out the various facilities. All the rooms are comfortable and clean but on the small side. The garden room was quite charming but we were unable to leave the windows open at night because of noise from the hostel behind. Fortunately the glazing kept noise at bay and otherwise the Sebnem is a nice quiet retreat from the business of its surroundings. The breakfast spread is large and served on a typically pleasant roof terrace. Best of all were the staff (as many others had found befoehand) who were always helpful and smiling. Whilst by no means an outstanding hotel, it is nevertheless great value and (if you don't mind a small room) a fine place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel, in unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: Twith3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Sebnem Hotel this past August for four nights. It is a very queint little hotel, with a great buffet breakfast. Not a huge selection, but the food was fresh, the juice (of our choice) freshly squeezed, and the coffee very good. The staff was very attentive, and Husseyn at the front was great, always willing to chat and help. The room was a bit small, with a tiny bathroom, but no worse than hotel rooms in European cities such as Paris but for a lot more affordable price. The location was perfect, a five to fifteen minute walk to most of the famous sights such as the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Grand Bazaar. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: beekeper
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. The location can not be beaten, within walking distance of all the major sites, near restaurants and transportation, yet tucked away on a small, side alley. Lovely, warm, welcoming staff who could not do enough for you. The rooms are small, but so homey and not "cookie cutter"; you are immediately immersed in Turkey. The breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Bosporus can not be imagined. Fresh squeezed orange juice, homemade rolls and pastries, local fruit, espresso coffee. What more could a traveler want! Made it hard to leave and sight see in the morning. Great place to relax at the end of the day as well, with free laptops available to guests to connect with home on this same roof terrace. You can't beat this place! I have told everyone I have met to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “delicious breakfast with superb view!”
Reviews.Author: Mizuho_Kamata_Kato
Reviews.Content: It was really a nice place to stay. Very good location... restaurants and bars are on the same street, you can enjoy night life easily. We appriciated their free water service. We poured fully to our 1.5l pet bottle and walked around hot Istanbul... so valuable!!! And I cannot emphasise anymore that breakfast is fabulous with superb Marmara ocean view. You must have freshly squeezed orange juice... like the one in Morocco!! The only thing we didn't like was that bathroom smelled... if this was fixed, I would rate this hotel as perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel, in a perfect location with friendly imformative staff”
Reviews.Author: Porcini
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Sebnem Hotel. The location was ideal, in the heart of Sultanahmet close to restaurants, bars and of course all the main sights. The staff were very friendly and very forth coming with information, Unal (I think that is how you spell it) was a wealth of knowledge and was able to give me tips for sites etc in other parts of Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sebnem - fantastic small hotel in Sultanhamed district”
Reviews.Author: VivienneSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to find the Sebnem Hotel on Tripadvisor and have spent 3 nights in this delightful small hotel in the heart of the Sultanhamed district of Istanbul. The hotel has only 15 rooms so there is a wonderful intimate feel to it. Beautifully decorated in the rich colours of Turkey sunsets - the rooms (though a little small) are very well appointed wÄ±th an excellent array of reference guides in addition to the more comprehensive library in the foyer of the hotel. Breakfast is a feast - wÄ±th an endless supply of freshly squeezed orange juice and delicious coffee to compliment the freshly baked pastries cold meats and cheeses. The latter is served on the roof-top terrace - wÄ±th a spectacular vÄ±ew of the Marmara Sea. But the best thing about this hotel has to be the service and the kind and generous hospitality offered by the staff. Huseyin in particular was wonderful to us and made us feel completely at home and thoroughly spoilt. But all the staff share a great service ethic and have left us feeling like we need to get back to the Hotel Sebnem as soon as time and finances will allow. We have loved Turkey and this hotel deserves all the commendations it has received. Vivienne and Diedrick - from Johannesburg South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: howellrec
Reviews.Content: We looked at this hotel based on the Lonely Planet recommendation - checked out it's website and decided to book. Booking was easy and done over the email, very efficient and friendly. The Sebnem certainly lives up to expectations - the staff are fantastic, so helpful and friendly. The room was excellent, the roof terrace had a great view and divine lounges (plus the wine and beer were well priced), free internet access was a bonus and the breakfast spread is amazing. The location couldn't be better - we were there for a week and just loved the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: clcsacto
Reviews.Content: I recently had a one night layover in Istanbul, so I scoured the internet for a reasonably priced hotel in Sultanahmet. I found and booked the Hotel Sebnem and just hoped it would be comfortable. When I arrived, I could not have been happier. Sebnem is a small, comfortable, immaculate hotel located just off the main street in Sultanahmet, and is a two block walk from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The terrace on the 3rd level has a lovely view of the Marmara, and doubles as a breakfast terrace in the morning and a quiet place for drinks in the evening. Breakfast is a veritable feast of fruits, vegetables, eggs, breads and pastries, and serving both Turkish and espresso coffees. The hotel staff was amazing too. I had a problem in the morning with my pre-arranged transportation to the airport. The receptionist called the transportation company for me and when that turned out to be a problem he called and booked a cab for me which arrived in less than a minute! I give the Sebnem two thumbs up (a 5!) and would recommend it to anyone who needs a comfortable, conveniently located hotel for a good price in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location and fab roof-top terrace”
Reviews.Author: Jennys_Travels
Reviews.Content: We couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. It's in a great location down a quiet side street (no noise disturbance at night at all) just off a lovely picturesque street with outside restaurants and cafes, and just 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Ayia Sofia. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, and our room was comfortable and very clean. But the absolutely best thing about this hotel was the stunning roof top terrace and the breakfast they serve up there. Probably the best breakfast we have ever eaten in any hotel - absolutely huge and with great coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice, and with such an amazing view, you could spend all day up there!

Reviews.Title: “Low key hotel with great deck and unbeatable breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mshoh
Reviews.Content: On a small side street in Sultanahmet district, Sebnem offers a good location, clean rooms and excellent value. We travelled in Turkey for 2 more weeks and found the Sebnem breakfast spread and tasty coffee and capucinnos - available anytime unparalleled and extremely generous. Most other hotels either serve nescafe or charge for a mediocre cappucino. Breakfast has great assortment of fruit and fresh baked treats, yogurt, salads, etc. After touring for part if the day it was a pleaseure coming back to hang out on their deck overlooking the Bosphorus and stretch out to read or snooze for a while and get re-charged to go out again. We stayed in the family room and the beds were good. The room was a little tight for 4 to live out of suitcases for a few days but it was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful but not intrusive. Several laptops were always available with internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Little paradise in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Juuljuliette
Reviews.Content: What a warm welcome we received!! Houssein and his colleague are really good hosts!! He even stayed up for us when we came home late from a Turkish wedding. The first few days it was raining cats and dogs, but staying at hotel Sebnem felt like staying in a sunny paradise. Everybody was so friendly. The breakfast is really superb. I gained 2 kilo's in 1 week. Thanks a lot! :-) Hotel Sebnem is located perfectly for the main highlights in Istanbul. The cozy street around the corner offers you everything a thirsty and hungry person needs. We absolutely will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Turkish hospitality, friendly and helpful staff, excellent location, clean, with great views.”
Reviews.Author: RnRCanberra
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Istanbul before, but this was a real find - a home away from home. A small hotel with friendly and very helpful staff. An excellent location close to the major tourist attractions of Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, etc, and an easy stroll to the Covered Bazaar and the tram line which runs over the Galata Bridge and on to Dolmabahce Palace. Rooms are very well maintained with all basic facilities. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a highlight, with freshly squeezed fruit juice, wide and plentiful choices at buffet breakfast, and great views over the Bosphorus. We did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great, hotel, great staff, amazÄ±ng view”
Reviews.Author: maddie_dwo
Reviews.Content: cute hotel with a great atmosphere and character. The buffet breakfast on the terrace was just amazÄ±ng. Great position close to all the attractions. Staff were helpful, relaxed and kind. Cute rooms and very very clean. Recommend to anyone wanting to stay somewhere close to the action without being right in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel with excellent...”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorNewHavenCT
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel with excellent service. The terrace on the roof has a great view of the harbor. The hotel has anticipated every comfort you might wish--carafes of water, foreign newspapers, wifi, tv. Highly recmended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: imoore45
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent staff. Lovely rooms and outside terrace. Close to all worth seeing in the Old Town and a peaceful haven. We had a garden room which was quiet and wonderful. Some of the rooms on the street can be noisy at weekends - no matter where you go in Old Town, you're not very far from potentially noisy bars. (As a regular traveller I recommend earplugs wherever you go!) Wonderful place, the management team went out of their way to help us when our flights(s) were cancelled. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: beverleigh
Reviews.Content: I can reccommend this little hotel wholeheartedly, clean rooms, towels, bedlinen and supercomfy bed, great choice breakfast, lovely roofterrace but best of all is the staff, everybody is very friendly and helpful, but Huseyn was a true gem

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, wonderful staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KathyLuray_Virginia
Reviews.Content: I recently had occasion to stay several days at the Sebnem as part of a group of 8 friends traveling together. We could not have had a better arrangement. The Sebnem's location makes it very easy to get around all of Istanbul. The rooms, while quite small, were very well appointed and comfortable. We visited many other hotels throughout Turkey on this trip and we never found a better breakfast than that served at the Sebnem in its charming roof top dining room. And last, but not least, the staff were all enormously friendly and helpful. Unal and Murat and Huseyin, the front desk staff, came up with anything we could ask of them. And Sira, Nino and Beka, whether serving us on the Terrace or cleaning our rooms, made our stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms, fabulous staff, perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: KarenMcCullough
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Sebnem was everything that I had hoped for it to be and more. The rooms had comfortable beds, nice bathrooms and were very clean. Breakfast on at rooftop cafe was exquisite and offered a variety of foods, drink with the highlight of fresh squeezed juice. Staff was very friendly, always helpful and willing to help with anything you needed from restaurant recommendations to sightseeing expeditions or simply chatting in the lobby about life in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great little & charming hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tudor4x4
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and I must say we haven't been deceived at all. It started well from the airport, since we reserved a car through the hotel to come and pick us up (25 euro, not a huge amount I must admit, although one can find cheaper transfers - taxi, bus shuttles or public transport, but we wanted to avoid any hassle). We didn't wait at all, the car was there on time. Moreover, since some of the streets of Sultanahmet were blocked because of the WRC rally, the drivers had an ingenious way of transferring us from one car to another in order to get us to the hotel. The room (one of the two with garden) was fairly sized (maybe a little bit small by western standards, but we didn't actually need more than that), very clean and tidy. It had a bookshelf full with guides in different languages (same goes for the entire hotel - lobby, terrace, one could find plenty of books and guides on Turkey/Istanbul) and in the small garden, which had mirrors all around to make it feel bigger, you had a comfortable couch with an exterior heater that you could turn on if the evening was too chilly. The TV was big enough and it had BBC news and CNN,which come in handy when you're stuck because of the ash cloud. Internet - one of the BIG pluses of this hotel - not only it had 3 laptops (one in the lobby and two on the terrace) available to the guests at any time, but it also offered free wi-fi throughout the hotel - when you have an iphone with you it's incredible - makes getting stuck not only comfortable but also much cheaper (thanks skype). Smiles - we've seen this is sort of the norm in Istanbul, but the staff at Sebnem always had a big smile and were ready to help. Same goes for the emails I exchanged with them when I reserved the hotel - very prompt and helpful. The terrace - I guess many hotels in Istanbul have it, but I doubt that you fell as comfy in all of them as you do on Sebnem's terrace. It has an open part and a closed part, both of which are very comfortable and pleasant - laptops, books, sea-views, comfy couches, heaters, wine (incredibly good Cappadocian wine), tea, beer - not to mention the fabulous home made breakfast that included a huge quantity of fresh juice. Ash-cloud - the staff at the hotel was very helpful with the "crisis" and helped by any means they could. We had only one extra-night (compared to other guests that had to stay longer), but we were able to keep the same room at the same price (we found out talking to other tourists that this wasn't necessarily the norm, other hotels raising the price for stranded people). Position in Istanbul - you cannot get much better than this - close to everything you need - monuments, shops, public transport (the tram which is a great way to get around is at ~7-10 min). Comments - a couple that I also made directly to the staff - the towels are changed everyday which is not necessarily eco-friendly and the combination of locks and keys (very big) is very noisy when opened or closed

Reviews.Title: “First class haven during volcanic ash fiasco!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmatisse1
Reviews.Content: This is a fab boutique hotel at a very modest price. You have heard about the all weather roof terrace, breakfasts and the service...all wonderful. The breakfast is very varied and so much is home made and freshly prepared on site. No extra cost for the freshly squeezed juice! There are many small touches which make the stay seem luxurious. Daily quality newspapers from France, England and the US. Drinking water in carafes in the rooms. Lovely traditional Ottoman furnishing with tasteful modern styling. Everything feels scrumptious but unfussy! Really well positioned although we could have done without the bin lorries clattering away at 3am and the cats wailing randomly but then I guess that's the city for you. The call to prayer at 5 does become music to you ears.... The care showed by the staff was second to none. We had our flight cancelled due to the ash cloud and Sebnem made all of us in that position feel secure. We were able to stay on with as little disruption as possible and our new needs were understood and anticipated. The lap tops and cable TV became life lines for may of us. There was no profiteering ...just a wish to see us settled and sorted. I wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else and highly recommend this hotel both as a base for sightseeing and as a place to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: debs1m
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The tone was set as soon as we arrived. Unfortunately a particularly unpleasant family bulldozed their way on to our pre-arranged transfer from the airport as they were unhappy with their own arrangements. Not a huge problem but as soon as we checked in HÃ¼seyin (I think!) immediately said that he had been made aware of this by the driver and told us that he would take off half the price of the transfer. We were shown to our room which was gorgeous. Very well presented and the bathrooms have all been recently updated, excellent showers! If you can, ask for a garden room. Throughout our stay we were recommended many excellent restaurants and the staff seemed to have an idea of somewhere to go whatever your mood. The hotel has a beautiful terrace which is open at all times with someone to serve drinks and nibbles which we actually found more enjoyable than going to the local bars (and cheaper!) There is also 24hr free internet access..... this became invaluable when our flights home were cancelled and the holiday plans needed to be changed somewhat. Again HÃ¼seyin and his team were endlessly helpful. They arranged somewhere else nearby for us to stay, then took us back when they had a room free. They calmly tolerated us constantly changing our minds about how long we were staying, whether we needed transfers etc etc. They even gave us a packed lunch to take when we left them for our journey home! I would absolutely stay here again and emphatically recommend it to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Many thanks to the team at Sebnem for making what could have been a disastrous holiday seem 100 times more relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: meemanmac
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sebnem was comfortable, friendly,stimulating,exciting and satisfying. The staff both downstairs at the front desk and upstairs in the indoor/outdoor terrace breakfast area were helpful, warm and interested in my experiences in the city. Thoughtful suggestions were offered when I asked about restaurants and "must see" sites. I particularly enjoyed an evening of rival soccer on the lobby tv with some of the staff and other guests. I found the beds comfortable and the overall cleanliness excellent. I do think however, there should be a system for replacing dirty towels "only as needed" (i.e., if you leave towels on the floor in the bathroom then they could be replaced). Also, clean glasses daily in the rooms would have been a nice touch. One last item, I think that "tea" should be complimentary all day, 1 euro is pricey. Overall the hotel was very clean, the staff professional and location active. Thanks for a memorable holiday in your beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Did not get to see the hotel because......”
Reviews.Author: CanadianWorldwide
Reviews.Content: They sent me a confirmation that my room was booked and then a few weeks later an email comes stating: " Iam very sorry to let you know that we made a mistake about your reservation. Our family room wasnt available in June. We had to cancel your reservation. We are very sorry about it and i just wanted to let you know as soon as possible then you can find another hotel. I can recommend you some hotels on the same street. You can try Hotel Alaturka or Alp Hotel. They are both nice and they have a family rooms too. We are very sorry again. Regards HÃ¼seyin" SO HOW GOOD A HOTELC CAN THIS BE ?

Reviews.Title: “More satisfied customers!”
Reviews.Author: PicaboCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebnem from March 10 until 15 and were very pleased with the location, the rooms and the terrace. The breakfast was phenomenal. Our room was on the same floor as the entrance to the terrace so we know how many hours the ladies put into the preparation (among other things.) Many thanks to the other staff members for being so conscientious and for their willingness to help us when it was needed. We can recommend the Sebnem without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah086
Reviews.Content: Everything about our week long stay at Sebnem was perfect. The staff went above and beyond to be cheerful and helpful. The location could not be better. The rooms were clean, comfortable and nicely appointed. The roof terrace was absolutely wonderful and made for the perfect place to have a glass of wine after a hard day of walking around the city. Breakfast was ample and delicious. On one night of our stay the hotel put on a BBQ which was also very good. When the hotel found out that it was my father's birthday, they presented us with a lovely big cake to enjoy as a family. There is nowhere else i would stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Exotic turkish flying carpet”
Reviews.Author: WOOLFHOUND
Reviews.Content: The rooftop deck breakfast of the Hotel Sebnem is the perfect way to start the Constinapolis early morning day. It does not get much better With the help of Huseyin, Unal and the rest of the staff each day in this ancient Byzantine citadel of fasination is a day to remember. The Yildiz cafe-restaurant tucked away close by, is excellent, a real 'food gem'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the sights in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Toujours_plus_haut
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sebnem based on reviews from other posters on Tripadvisor, and I was not disappointed. If I remember correctly, I was in room 301 which is a single room, and it really is quite small, but I did not mind as I spent very little time in the room anyway. The room cost EUR70 per night which is perhaps a bit expensive, but I was told that outside of the peak season the room would cost EUR40 which seems reasonable. The big selling point for this hotel is it's location. You are literally less than 5 minutes walk from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and right in the heart of historical Sultanahmet. There is also a taxi stop just down the road from the hotel, which is convenient for getting around town and to the airport. The hotel has two rooms on the ground floor with a small garden/patio attached to it. These seem a good option, should you wish to spend a quiet night in with your loved-one. Otherwise, there are several bars/restaurants nearby, if you fancy a drink or a bite to eat. Breakfast was included in the price and is served from the dining area at the topfloor, with a nice view of the Sea of Marmara and Istanbul. The breakfast is substantial, with a selection of cheese, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, meat and fresh bread. They also have a great selection of pasty, for those of us with a sweet tooth. The hotel offer free internet, either from a desktop computer downstairs in the reception, or via two laptops in the dining room area. The staff is friendly and helpful, and always there to give you tips and directions to the various sights, or just have a talk about Istanbul and Turkey in general. I would like to give a special thanks to Mr Unal who was very friendly and welcoming. I'd be happy to stay at the Sebnem again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but praise for Sebnem!”
Reviews.Author: GPfocus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming little hotel in Istanbul for one week and I have only good things to say. The location is amazing; the view from the roof terrace is not to be believed. The breakfast is also superb, the rooms are modern and comfy, and the staff is warm kind and cordial. This hotel retains the charm of the old eastern empires with all the facilities of a modern hotel. If you are in Istanbul do not pass up the Sebnem hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wonderar
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel in excellent location. Was made very welcome on arrival. Great staff altogether. Located on a very pretty cobbled street with the Hotel Hanedan next door, plus the Alaturka, the hotel Peninsula and hotel Alp opposite with the Hotel Zoe at the top of the very short street. The 4 Season was a few yards futher on (incidentaly I would not have paid the extra for this very smart hotel as although it looked wonderful, outside the walls the area immediately around was pretty grim). We had room 17 which was at the front on the very corner. Very small room but spotlessly clean with solid wood floors plus a small shower room as well. Towels supplied but no face cloths or even a wash basin plug so remember to take your own! A hook for the towels in the bathroom would be a good idea plus a clock in the bedroom. Comfy bed and pillows. Beakfast was wonderfull! A big plus was the jug of fresh squeezed orange and pomegranate juice they prepared just for you every morning. There was the usual continental plus a great spread of sweet and savory pastries plus fresh bread, jams and honey. Fruit salad, yogurt plus salad items. Coffee was made in huge Italian coffee machine. Truely scrumptious! The roof terrace where breakfast was served had great views over to the other side of the sea of Marmara and in the evenings it was possible to sit up there and use the 2 laptops and have a beer or coffee. A backgammon set was supplied as well. The location is great for everywhere. The main tourist sights are only minutes away by foot. To reach Topkapi and Haghia Sofia just turn right at the top of the street and walk up the hill. Topkapi will be in front of you (get there around 10 to avoid crowds going in the harem and treasury). For the ferries just follow the tram lines down just past Topkapi, an easy 15 minutes walk and a great 1.5tl ride. Loads of restaurants within yards. We would go back again as staff very friendly, hotel so cute and fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fulesh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Sebnem for 4 nights and it is a great small hotel with a helpfull staff and excellent breakfast. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: SayGo_IGo_UGo2
Reviews.Content: We stayed four night and could have stayed longer. The staf is fun and friendly and can help with everything, cabs, day trips, everything. Had a great garden room, with a beautiful bath. The hotel was on a quiet street in a great neighborhood with your choice of restaurants. The best thing about our stay was the incredible rooftop breakfast every morning. There had to be a hundredd items to choose from, and all delicious. I couldn't wait until morning. And one evening the staff stoked up the grill and served a perfect dinner. We had an incredble stay. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding charm, location and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Anaxander
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sebnem was our first stop on our honeymoon to Turkey. We were absolutely thrilled with our stay. The hotel could not be in a more convenient location for exploring the Sultanahmet area of Turkey. Not only that, but it's tucked into the most charming little corner of a cobblestone street. Our room was very romantic and cozy. Everything was extremely clean and the breakfast each morning was great. I don't think you can beat the terrace, either. Looking out at the sea every morning only added to the charm. The hotel has many books on various Turkish sites strewen throughout the common areas, and even quite a few in our room. The hotel operators were so friendly and helpful, often giving me advice on how to get somewhere and how much to pay for a taxi to various places. The only thing I would change would be the 25 euro airport pickup. While it was nice to have someone waiting for us when we arrived after a long flight, it took a while for the driver to arrive, and you can take a taxi for about 35 TL. 25 euros is way too much to pay for such a relatively short ride. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSmilesalot
Reviews.Content: Everything was right about this place. The staff were lovely and friendly, the location unbeatable, the hotel and the room clean and well presented. I have already recommended this place to other friends. We all hope to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: roastedsalmon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We had a room with a canopy bed that comfortably accomodated 2 of us. Our room had access to a little shared courtyard garden. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was also rather quiet when we stayed there - no problems with noise. Breakfast is on a roof terrace with a very nice view of the Bosphorus River. The breakfast selection is buffet-style, with a selection of fruit preserves, breads, fresh fruits, cold cuts, some turkish pastries and yogurt. Totally adequate and actually quite delicious. The location is very central. The service was nice. The price was reasonable. I would go back to this hotel again if I'm back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: SarahF0875
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sebnem for three nights. What a find! Agree entirely with last two posters so no need to repeat their comments. All in all very comfortable and clean hotel in a secluded (but extremely convenient) spot with the most friendly and helpful staff, not to mention a fantastic breakfast on offer every morning, much of which seemed to be homemade. We went on to stay at a "luxury" hotel on the coast and its breakfast offering didn't come close to Sebnem's. Am surprised this little gem isn't ranked higher than it currently is. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking to base themselves in the Sultanamet district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Billybob65
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the excellent review by Sally, which captured all of the good things about the Sebnem (there were no bad things). I also want to commend the extremely friendly and always helpful staff, who were consistently willing to do whatever was necessary to make the stay memorable. And, again, location was the best, within walkinmg distance of everything, including the tram, which is easy to use and a must to get to the farther reaches of Istanbul. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet's Wallet-Friendly Gem”
Reviews.Author: sallymak26
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant and perfect spot for exploring Istanbul! My mother and I stayed at the Sebnem for three nights in August and had a lovely stay. The hotel is located off a little side street in a happening section of the Sultanahmet neighborhood - conveniently located to all of Istanbul's most famed attractions. While at night not a few hundred yards away there is a bustling street filled with happening bars and restaurants that spill onto the charming street, the noise cannot be heard at the Sebnem, tucked away in its quiet nook. Also, we were never once disturbed by the call to prayer at early hours of the morning. Maybe because the windows weren't opened at that time, but unlike most hotel recs I've seen about Sultanahmet hotels, we NEVER were awoken by it (and I'm a LIGHT sleeper). The hotel is kept impeccably ....while there is no elevator, the staff rushes to help with your baggage (no matter how heavy or large). The room was fairly small - but what can you expect in Europe, esp with the size of our luggage? - and had beautiful hardwood floors, a new air conditioning unit, flatscreen television, and a small but perfectly fine bathroom. The shower was one of those Euro-style glass stalls and was small, but the modern double showerhead mounted on the wall blasted the best water pressure I've ever encountered in Europe...always hot water as well! The star of the hotel - aside from the most accomodating staff I've seen in a while- is its rooftop terrace. Traditional Turkish breakfast is included and is served by the family upstairs in a beautiful spread (i'm kicking myself for not taking a photo). Everything from deliciously fresh melon, to homemade cakes and borek, to delicious yogurt and watercress, to yummy olives, tomato and cheese. You could have yourself whatever hot beverage you'd like (they made a fabulous cup of capuccino) and sit outside enjoying a spectacular view of the Marmara Sea. The terrace was open at all hours for anyone who wanted to sit and relax...there were two laptops free of charge with free wi-fi for checking email (a computer was also availble for use downstairs by the front desk)...a bunch of hookah (nargile) water pipes for anyone who wanted to use, and Turksih music lightly playing in the background. Lite snacks and beverages were also available. All in all a terrific place to rest yourselves after a day of touring beautiful Istanbul. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Sultanahmet Park ....and about 7 mins from the metro (which I highly recommend using to get to places like the Spice Bazaar and other neighborhoods like Galata and Tunel). The metro tram system is above ground and one of the cleanest I've seen...and SUPER cheap (as are most things in Istanbul). Kudos to the Sebnem...I'll certainly be staying here again on my next trip to Turkey! PS - take advantage of their airport pickup...worth the extra 25 Euro...very efficient!

Reviews.Title: “They've got it right!”
Reviews.Author: iwantappletea
