Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul before & while Sultanhamet has many quaint hotels, the Hotel Sebnem has got the mix of friendliness & professional service just right. The staff are genuinely welcoming & unobtrusive, the rooms - although not the largest for a long stay with small kids- are tastefully decorated, clean, quiet, & beds are comfortable. Get up to the terrace every morning for one of the best breakfasts in Istanbul, with delicious cappuccino/hot chocolate/tea...pastries galore & wonderful fresh fruit, cheese etc. We will certainly be back. The staff here made our 2 small boys feel welcome & that made us relax. They also dealt with a broken a/c in our room immediately, providing a good fan to use until maintenance arrived. Then they stayed to check the fan was working again. They clearly enjoy the hotel & their jobs- it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderful hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Sherro0
Reviews.Content: The Sebnem was an oasis in the middle of Istanbul. A great location , only minutes from the major tourist attractions, deep in the heart of Sultanamet. Rooms were very clean and amazingly quiet. All staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfasts and barbecues were exceptional. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: alicejane91
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Breakfast was different to the standard toast and cereal I was accustomed to, but very nice all the same. Walking distance to many attractions including the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, and a quick tram ride from the Spice and Grand Bazaars. Good, very friendly service. Basic, but clean and well maintained rooms. Loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: retiredfuntravellers
Reviews.Content: We just spent six nights at the Hotel Sebnem and were very pleased with our stay. The room was a bit small but the air conditioning worked very well, the windows blocked outside noise and the bathroom had modern accomodations. All of the staff were all very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. We really had a sense that they enjoyed their guests. The breakfast buffet offered a great variety of foods and we were served coffee to order. All this plus free internet service !

Reviews.Title: “Felt like coming home”
Reviews.Author: seeyahale
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 including 2 children aged 13 & 10 stayed here for 5 nights in the family room. My children said it felt like coming home at the end of each long day of sight-seeing. Staff were all so helpful and friendly and the breakfast each morning was our favourite of the 9 hotels we stayed in across Europe. The roof terrace has incredible views and was such a relaxing spot to have a glass of wine, read a book, snooze, catch up on emails or appreciate life. We chose an airport pickup which went without a hitch and they happily stored our luggage for 3 nights while we went travelling in Turkey. Location was brilliant - just behind the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi. We would all love to stay there again.....soon!

Reviews.Title: “Family room worked well”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'CalGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here with my two teens in the family room. We had a very warm welcome and a delicious breakfast. The room and bathroom is small, but the bathroom is up to date and the room has beautiful wooden floors and fun Turkish decor. At first we were surprised to only find one sheet and a blanket on the bet, but the staff was happy to provide the extra sheet upon request. The location can't be beat; with one day for touring, we walked to three major sites, bargained in the little market (the big one is closed on Sunday) and still enjoyed some relaxing time in our room. The air conditioning was much appreciated as well. Around the corner was a delicious dinner. The Sebnem Hotel helped make a great trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great service, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: cal4361
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference north of Istanbul for 5 days and planned to spend 2 more days in Istanbul to sight see. Checked out the internet and saw the reviews for Sebnem and decided to go with them the morning we left the conference. Great choice. The staff was most helpful with dinner suggestions and getting around town. Easy walking distance to the old city sights. Quiet cul-de-sac location. Discount for cash. Internet on the rooftop was helpful for keeping in contact with kid at home. Loved the terrace; after a long morning of bargaining at the bazaar, having a beer, reading a book and napping on the terrace were great. Oh yeah, and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: myhomeistanbul
Reviews.Content: sebnem hotel is so friendly and everything is great..

Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tangoake
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of reviews on this sight. 100 euros a night. In a dead end street so quiet (except for cats and 5am call to prayer). We had room 203 which has access to a garden. Room 201 next door is only other room with access. It's on the ground level down a hallway so no street noise or disturbance from other guests. Breakfast was included in the rate. Good selection compared to many others we saw over the next 8 weeks. Excellent selection of resteraunts. Try Metropolis cafe and Resteraunt. Great service and location. The hotel staff were really helpful and not fawningly overfriendly. I'd adivse booking in advance as we had to stay in 4 different hotel for the 4 nights we were there because it was quite busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AlexBalham
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sebnem is a real gem. It's located a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofia. The staff were excellent, very friendly and ready with helpful suggestions. The roof top bar with a view over the straits and the sea was stunning and the breakfast offered a huge range of choice. It also has a couple of computers with free internet access... I would definitely stay at the Hotel Sebnem again when travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We planted "baby vines" at the Sebnem & look at them now!”
Reviews.Author: MarnieFinklestein
Reviews.Content: Yes, I am Looking for Alper at the Sebnem 2005 and earlier. It was before it was known. I kept writing reviews ( at least 5 and all were lost), so I am trying again. Only the one about Alper would go through! We planted tiny vines out front, and now they are huge and and gorgeous! We also started planting flowers-and Wow! We stayed there at least 3 time, and each time would bring suitcases full of contemporary Travel Mags to spruce up the lobby , and bought local plates, bowls, and other local wares, including pillows for the lobby sofa, and searching the basement for ancient rugs. The hotel location was out of the way, so we told Alper he needed a sign that could be seen up the hill-and the tile sign is still there, leading the way, and a professional could not have done a more fantastic job Our last trip there, he was developing a beautiful new breakfast area, with a great bar, and the most gorgeous sight looking out over Istanbul and the Bosporous. We even did a web video for him-the Wednesday Market-and all around, and I was even in it (very small and buying "Nar" which in the USA=pomegranites) . We had to cut our three weeks short to 1 week, because my husband had had a bleed in his brain 5 years before, and he knew he was in troublel. The staff at the Hotel did a fantastic job , to get him out on a 6:30am flight without the $600 penalty, in less than 12 hrs. !

Reviews.Title: “Great place, don't hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: maryjh
Reviews.Content: Stay here! Terrific breakfast with amazing food. Great coffee (important!) unbeatable neighborhood and location (next to Four Seasons in Sultanahnemet) and terrific staff!!! Thank you everyone at Hotel Sebnem! The Grossmans.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: 57Lynn
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Sebnem for it's warm and friendly staff also the terrace on the rooftop as a great view and the seating is very confortable. Their breakfast is the best we had in Turkey, fresh squeeze orange juice, cappucino and a wide variety of food. We stayed there for 3 nights, our room was extremely clean and we had access to a nice garden. The staff was very helpful and the hotel is near all the main attractions. Overall a great place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with wonderful service and spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: ENNYC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sebnem was a wonderful home base for our extended stay in Istanbul. Right in the heart of the historic district, this small boutique hotel has clean and comfortable rooms, a warm and friendly staff, and best of all a spacious, comfortable terrace with spectacular views of the Bosphorus and a huge, delicious buffet breakfast spread. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: Oynter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two outstanding features! - the friendly, helpful staff and its excellent location. We enjoyed our break very much, not least because we were staying here! It is well located for all the main sights ( and more ) and there are plenty of restaurants close by which made the evenings relaxed with no travelling to think about! Our bedroom was a bit on the small size and lacked one or two obvious things but it served its purpose. It was very clean and our towels were changed daily. Breakfast was of a good standard and it was so pleasant to sit on the terrace to enjoy the food - and the view! The staff are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in excellent location with friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Marie-NYNY
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel, as it has comfortable rooms and modern bathroom, an outstanding location in Sultanahmet, close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and tram station, good breakfast served on the terrace with incredible views of the Bosphorus and very friendly and helpful staff. Would most definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem... Simply the Best.”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieFrenchie1
Reviews.Content: Don't look any further... when visiting Istanbul you have to stay at the Sebnem. From the get go, when I was in the USA and I inquired about the Sebnem, my e-mails were answered very promptly. When we got there, the staff was warm and welcoming. Our rooms were cozy, extremely clean, all had their own bathroom with spotless showers, floor and toilet thanks to Nino. We soon found ourselves on the rooftop terrace. The views were breathtaking and the seating very comfortable; an awesome place to relax. The breakfasts were by far the best we had in all of Turkey. We did a 9-day road trip, stayed at many hotels and Sebnem had them all put to shame. The Sebneb not only offers a wide variety of food prepared by Sira, but they also serve freshly squeezed orange juice and Beka's cappucinos are some of the best in Turkey. The location is perfect; all tourist attractions are within walking distance and can be seen from the rooftop terrace. The best part about the Sebnem is without a doubt the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Unal and Murat go out of their way to help with suggestions of places to visit, getting maps, checking flight arrangements, helping with car rental and even finding us suitable accomodations when we came back from our trip and the Sebnem was full. One day, we even ran into Fatih who had the afternoon off up by the Grand Bazar and he decided to be our tour guide for the afternoon. That was an unexpected treat. He took us to some places we would not have known about. Once a week, they have an evening BBQ on the terrace, my advice is don't miss it! The price is cheap and the food delicious and abundant. The Sebnem was definitely a home away from home... a small hotel with a huge heart!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: gedoxski
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the hotel and had a great time in Istanbul. The hotel arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the airport which was great as there was 4 of us. All the staff at the hotel made us very welcome and were very helpful with any request we had. The breakfasts were great with plenty of choice and the rooftop terrace is fantastic with lovely views across the Mamara sea. The hotel is situated in a little side street with other guest houses/ hotels just off a road that is full of bars,cafes, restaurants and shops,and is also just a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace so all in all a great location. Would recommend the hotel and Istanbul to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: fspring
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The guys are very friendly and kind. It made me a beautiful impression. Very nice hotel. Francesca

Reviews.Title: “It's all true and more”
Reviews.Author: mcadoo11
Reviews.Content: There is a reason for all of those great reviews of Hotel Sebnem -- they are all true! We stayed there for five nights. The hotel is well located in Sultanahmet, attractive, and a good value. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've ever enjoyed in terms of quality and amount of choices. The rooftop eating / lounge with close by, unimpeded views of the Sea of Marmara was awesome. Best of all was the incredible staff -- they could not have been more friendly or helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: worldwideellen
Reviews.Content: The Sebnem is on a quiet, no-cars street, two blocks from a pleasant district of shops and restaurants. All of the major sites are at easily walkable distances. During our three night stay we became quite fond of "our neighborhood" and even began nodding and waving at familiar faces. Everything said about the Sebnem is true. Our family room was elegantly appointed, very clean, and we found it quite quiet -- even though it faced the street. The worst noise was when some early-morning departures rolled their wheelies up the cobblestoned street instead of carrying them. The breakfasts are great -- espresso much appreciated -- and the water views from the roof terrace are terrific. Staff is friendly. Email communications are quickly responded to. Maybe the worst thing I can say about the place is that the marble stairs are potentially treacherous -- watch your step! If we have the chance, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: matevzh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is set in small, closed to traffic street, with great terrace and excellent views. Due to its location it has great view to bosphorus and short access to Sultanahmet sites. Room and bathroom were spotless and quite modern. However, our room was unfortunately on a small side (room 301), which is quite small for a couple and putting down two suitcases. My only remark actually goes to a size of a room, but otherwise i would only have compliments. Room had all necessary amenities, including large LCD, hair dryer and drinkable water. Breakfast was served on a terrace, and it was excellent. Freshly pressed juice, good coffee with great choice (enough of everything!). We always sat there for an hour, as this breakfast with excellent view was a real treat. Terrace, both inside and outside is nicely decorated, and it was a pleasure to relax there during a rainy evening. Complimentary was use of notebooks, even wifi was available in our room. Staff was also very good, friendly and helpful. Did i mention that the cook makes excellent cakes for breakfast? This is not the cheapest option but certainly my first choice on next trip to Istanbul. The only reason why i didn't give five points to overall rating was due to the size of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, and ideal location to visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ConsultantGAL68
Reviews.Content: I recently had a chance to return to the Sebnem, this time with my wife. I had mentioned that it was a small (22 room) pensione type hotel and I think she was expecting a hostel situation. Since my business trip last year the Sebnem made some renovations, which make the stay even more comfortable. The small staff (six people who are there constantly) makes it a welcoming atmosphere. They were very helpful prior to and during the stay. Breakfast is included and the view of the Bosporous from the dining area terrace is special. The rooms have wifi and there are computers handy in the entrance area and the terrace. What makes all of this even more appealing is the proximity to the major tourist attractions in the Sultanahmet area, literally a couple of blocks. The convenience is great and the hotel is around the corner from the busiest restaurant/bar area. Plenty of choices for food and drink. Unal, the manager, has always immediately returned emails and followed up on requests. He and the others are good humored and add to the family atmosphere. I would stay there again and i recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fully recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Touraj
Reviews.Content: I just visited Istanbul for 4 days and stayed at Sebnem Hotel. The hotel receptions are very kind and helpful, the breakfast was awesome, the rooms are modern and clean, and the best thing was the nice view in the lounge at the roof, where Notebooks with Wifi Internet are provided free of costs. I can fully recommend the hotel and I will surely stay at this hotel again, next time with my wife! A+

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: IsabelMay
Reviews.Content: The location is great and easy walking distance to most venues. The room was small and not that pleasant despite the high price. The 25 euro airport collection was helpful in a new city but the return was expensive for only 15 minutes and the taxi driver had his hand out for a tip. Obviously the hotel only gave him the minimum. On booking out we were charged the highest price for drinks we have paid anywhere. And we received no invoice or account upon checking out. Not very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in a great location with friendly staff & wonderful food”
Reviews.Author: marley088
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the very friendly Sebnem Hotel in March '09. We shared a small trible room which was spotlessly clean with very comfy beds. The highlight of the Sebnem is the amazing buffet breakfast served in the lovely roof top terrace overlooking the sea. You are spoiled for choice with so many lovely varieties of home cooked food and delicious home baked cakes and pastries. The staff are wonderful, extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. It is on a nice quiet street less then 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque, The Haghia Sofia , Topkapi Palace and the Sultanahmet bus and tram stops. There are a good variety of cafe's and restaurants in the surrounding streets. If you like walking most of the sights including the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar are within 15/20mins walk. We are glad to heartily recommend The Sebnem, the wonderful Sultanahmet area and the amazing city of Istanbul. Ellen & friends. Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, relaxed hotel close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: Spencerswood
Reviews.Content: I fully echo what has been written in other recent reports - friendly, helpful staff, good breakfast spread, always with home made cakes and pastries, pleasant roof top lounge/dining area, free internet with three laptops available to use, and convenient location close to many of the attractions and near to train and tram lines. The Sultanahmet area is full of hotels, hostals, tourist shops and restaurants - so most people in the immediate area are visitors and tourists. If you want a more varied nightlife, or to be closer to Turkish people or choice of restaurants you will need to travel over to Galata, Istiklal or other areas. Our room was on the small side, but had a recent modern bathroom and flat screen TV with all the satellite channels you need. It was also noisy - it faced on to a small shared space, and the residents of the hostal next door certainly enjoyed themselves most nights well into the early hours. Coupled with the call to prayer at 5.30 am, on one night there didn't seem much time between the two! However, I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: donnaweb
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Sebnem. The location is great, the views from the terrace are wonderful. The rooms are a bit small, but that is pretty typical for Turkey. The price was a bit high for the small room. The buffet breakfasts we had every morning were the best that we had in Turkey. Huge delicious figs, fresh yogurt, nuts, eggs, etc, plus all the tea or coffee you could drink day and night. The staff was very helpful, but also found that to be typical for Turkey. We really enjoyed lounging on the roof terrace before or after a day of sightseeing watching the ships go by on the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: laurencita
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. I think the other reviews speak for themselves. But, like most of the others I found the staff to be amazingly warm and helpful. The rooftop terrace was perfect, even in winter! While sitting on the terrace drinking free espresso from the kitchen and checking my email on the free laptops the staff came over and turned on the heater. They even brought popcorn for me to munch on! What amazing hospitality! The buffet breakfast is more than just the standard western continental breakfast. They also have a huge assortment of turkish food (I think) in addition to the cereals, toasts, eggs, fruit, fresh juices, etc. The rooms are very clean, and that's a lot coming from someone who normally combs the sheets before climbing in to bed. The bathroom was modern and our room had a nice flat screen tv with cable. This hotel is exactly what it should be, affordable, clean, friendly, convenient and a place that you enjoy returning to after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: LorrieClive
Reviews.Content: After a false start in Istanbul we phoned the Sebnem late in the evening to see what accommodation was available for a five night stay and a positive and welcoming response lead us to the hotel the following morning. We immediately liked the room (room12 which had recently been refurbished) and were invited to have breakfast which surpassed our expectations by far with freshly squeezed orange juice, cappuccino, fresh rolls and honey to name but a few. All this and splendid views over the Sea of Marmara. Free internet, flat screen TV, fresh water and powerful showers with spotlessly clean rooms almost completed the package but the hotel team (Unal, Fatih and the 'breakfast/house ladies') added the final touches with their unstinting offers of help anytime of the day or night. Proximity to key attractions (Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia) is a real bonus. We would not hesitate to stay there again. Clive & Lorrie

Reviews.Title: “We left a piece of our hearts at the Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: GeeDevon
Reviews.Content: Huseyin, the owner of the Sebnem seems to have got it right! A happy staff makes all the difference to the quality of one's stay. We recieved attentiveness and thoughtfulness, trust and friendliness from the whole of the staff without exception and we felt so at ease and valued. The rooms had really modern bathrooms and televisions, lovely wooden floors and comfy beds. The breakfasts were absolutely magnificent in their variety and freshness - self service from a myriad of choices - vegetables, fresh fruit ready sliced and in salad, pancakes,pastries, yoghust and honey eggs, cheeses, cakes , dried fruits and nuts, meats .... I could go on and on. Information and guide books were available and visit suggestions made. The staff seemed to have infinite patience and real caring. The location was just perfect - so near the palace and the two famous mosques, and the terrace had a superb view of the Bosphorus and a mere 7or 8 minute walk to the ferries.. In short, a gem of a hotel and every member of staff, a star!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: phillee
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at Sebnem in a twin room having travelled solo from London by train on the old Orient Express route and was definitely in need of a relaxed hotel. It is a small hotel run by very friendly people. The Sunday morning I arrived at 8.30 am both tired and hungry, the room was obviously not vacated, however I was made feel at home and given a lovely Mediterranean buffet breakfast on the rooftop with great views over the Bosphorous. HÃ¼seyin on the desk could not have been more helpful in suggesting where to eat and how to use the tram / ferry system. Upon arrival he immediately made a reservation for me to see the majestic Sema Ceremony (Whirling Dervishes). A lovely hotel for a solo trip and I look forward to returning again with my wife. Philip Avoca, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: ckim32
Reviews.Content: Similar to all of the other reviews for this hotel, hands down I would recommend this hotel to other friends who are looking to visit Istanbul. The hotel staff go above and beyond their call of duty and made us feel we were staying at a family friend's house as opposed to a hotel. The breakfast and drinks on the rooftop was the most memorable part of the stay with also free internet. You can always have tea, coffee and filtered water available anytime. It's close to restaurants and bars and walking distance to the blue mosque. Hotel was recently renovated so it was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here...location, price, comfort...perfect”
Reviews.Author: rmwjr
Reviews.Content: The other reviews say it all...you should stay here. Walking distance to major sites, food, shopping. Price is great, rooms are clean and the roof has great views. The staff is excellent. Visit the lamp/carpet shop on the corner. We used their drivers for airport transfers and would recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Very recomendable. Service was excellent. We felt very much at home”
Reviews.Author: EssieAlicante
Reviews.Content: We chose the place to have a coffee at the terrace and ended up changing from the hotel we originally booked to Sebnem Hotel. The personnel was very attentive and caring, the views are lovely, breakfast was excellent, perfect and centric location, quiet surroundings, I agree with all the good critics I read at this website. I certainly will go back and can warly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing; I do not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler12345
Reviews.Content: I love Istanbul and decided to stay at this hotel for my birthday with my girlfriend for five nights after reading a number of positive reviews on Tripadvisor. My experience at the Sebnem hotel was not a positive one and I will not stay there again. On the positive side: As highlighted by other reviewers, the hotel's breakfast is excellent and its location is central. However, we encountered several problems during our stay: 1) As some other reviewers already noted, the hotel is noisy. The gentleman at the reception was talking loudly with family, friends who came over throughout the day and night, and the huge television in the main reception area was turned on all the time, well until after midnight. We could follow all television audio and conversations word-for-word from our room. This was annoying when we tried to sleep. I suspect the problem is not as bad for rooms that are not located near the reception area so please make sure you ask for a room that is as far away as possible from the reception when making a reservation at the Sebnem hotel! 2) We were charged more upon check-out than agreed on when we made our reservation. Before our arrival I called the hotel and negotiated a 10% discount (for paying in cash and staying five nights). The gentleman handling the checkout at the reception refused to apply the discount and took quite an intimidating posture. In the end, we paid up because we were in a hurry. We left, feeling really bad about the situation however. I understood the economic downturn is rough on the Sebnem hotel as well but its owner should realize that strong arming guests for small amounts of cash does not pay off in the long run. Moreover, although I understand that the never ending negotiating process is part of the local culture, I have stayed at plenty of Turkish hotels that are more straightforward (actually this is the first Turkish hotel where I encountered this problem). 3) There was an issue with the cleanliness of our room as room service did not clean the room every day during our stay. The reception did issue us new, clean towels upon request however. 4) It was very cold when we were visiting Istanbul so we were happy that the hotel's heating was working properly. The same cannot be said about the warm water however and at several occasions we had to contend ourselves with a cold shower. In short, we had a somewhat disappointing experience at the Sebnem hotel and recommend others to explore one of the many other hotels in the same street / neighborhood. If you do decide to stay at the Sebnem hotel, please 1) insist on a room far away from the reception area or bring earplugs, 2) if you stay for more than one night explicitly ask the reception to clean your room when you leave during the morning, and 3) leave plenty of time before your departure to 'settle' the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: DannyRoman
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days in Istanbul and I was looking for a good located hotel within walking distance from the principal sites. I chose this hotel for the reviews in here. The hotel is located in a beautiful alley, in the heart of the restaurant area in Sultanahmet (Akbiyik Caddesi). From the hotel you can walk to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, the Basilica Cisterna and Arasta Bazaar, which are top attractions. The tram station is in a walking distance (8 blocks aprox). A 15 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar. The personel of the hotel were VERY kind. They were always willing to help with directions and suggestions. The receptionist name is Ãœnal who provided me all kinds of information and even helped me organise a fast visit to Epheso by plane; he was very kind every day. The hotel is not a chain hotel, so dont expect the facilities (no free toiletries, elevator or the room furbishing), is like a very nice inn, though the heatting, AC and hot water works 24 hrs a day. The room have wooden plank floor, which is a little noisy but warm. The bed is firm but deliciously soft and the conforter was good, plenty of clean, white towels every day. The bathroom are perfect, the water pressure is more than enough and the toilet flush perfect. The breakfast is from 8 to 11 am, at the terrace, in winter is enclosed and heated. The food is abundant in pastries, cereal (just corn flakes), assorment of juices, fruits, cheeses, cold meats, fresh vegetables and coffe/tea. You can buy fresh squeezed fruit juices for 2 euros. At the lobby, there is a library of books about Istanbul, which you can read and get informed about the city. The rooms have no TV but wasnt necessary since one has so much to read and plan to do for the next day. Around the hotel you can find a lot of good restaurant for every day. I recommend the Albura Restaurant, located at Akbiyik Caddesi, just 1 block at your right hand (ask for Mehmet). Definetly this a great hotel for its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: lizgordie
Reviews.Content: Apart from a grouchy driver who the hotel arranged to pick us up from the airport (and who was later apologetic anyway), we loved everything about the Sebnem. The hotel is quiet and small, so probably not for partying backpackers, but was just what we wanted. The room was smallish but beautifully set out and immaculately clean. Breakfasts were delicious, including excellent espresso coffee. All of the staff were friendly and helpful but Unal, one of the guys on reception was our favourite. The location could not have been better. If you have some extra funds ask the staff to direct you to the seafood restaurant nearby (quite pricey but very good).

Reviews.Title: “breakfast and drinks on the Sebnem roof patio were a real treat”
Reviews.Author: vjaldridge
Reviews.Content: After traveling through Jordan, Syria and Lebannon we arrived in Istambul exhausted. We were hoping the Sebnem lived up to its beautiful pictures and description on their website. We took the trolley in to town. Walking behind the Blue Mosque we passed the Four Season's Hotel and new we must be in a good neighborhood. At the end of the street, we recognized the sign that we had seen on the website. We entered the door into a small lobby where the staff was anxiously awaiting us since we had missed seeing their driver at the airport. As were guided upstairs through hotel it seemed more like a home and we noticed the interesting art work on the walls and beautiul wooden doors to the rooms. The rooms were small but equally well decorated. The newly tiled floor to ceiling bathrooms were a real treat with modern sinks and showers. Next we wanted to see if the hotel truely had a top floor patio where you could sit and see the ocean. This became our favorite spot to enjoy drinks overlooking the beautiful Meditteranean or catch up on e-mails. We were told that breakfast would also be served here. The next morning being used to usual continental breakfasts, we were unprepared for the feast that awaited us. A buffet of delcious Turkish dishes and pastries and juices was available. They even had decaffeinated tea which I had been unable to obtain at our other hotels. This small reasonable boutique hotel situated in the historic district was quiet , close to the trolley line for easy access the port and the othe side of Istanbul and was a wonderful place to stay. The friendly staff was helpful in making recommendations and reservations for restaurants as well as events across the city. I miss our breakfasts overlooking the Mediteranean and look forward to returning to this spot again. Valerie Aldrige

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bechedeux
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, the room was immaculate,cozy, great modern bathroom, great cleaning service. My favorite part was the roof deck and the best breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: montemor
Reviews.Content: The Sebnem hotel is one of the very few hotels, I have ever stayed in, that made me feel completely at home thanks to the excellent atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff and exemplary management by Baha. I would thoroughly recomment it . There is no doubt that I will stay in this hotel, when I return to Istanbul, Inshallah. Greetings Ward

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem , we will return!”
Reviews.Author: portukalis
Reviews.Content: Walk into the Sebnem and relax, you are in the right place. The staff are friendly and helpful in every way, we miss them! The rooms clean,cosy,and quiet, difficult to choose between staying downstairs with a little patio, marble fountain and plants, or upstairs with sea views.We chose both and everyone was happy. The bathrooms are great, super shower and plenty of white towels. For breakfast,lots of fresh food from A,for Apricots to Y, for Yogurt (I could not see anything for Z, but it was probably there too!) That happens up on the terrace where there is comfortable seating, soft cushions and shawls,a great place to have a drink, check your email,read and listen to good music as you watch the ships go by. And when you do go out, you will find you are a step away from most things you have come to see in Istanbul. What a wonderful time we had, thanks for your hospitality Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mayaji
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, down a quiet side street in Sultanahmet district, and is within easy walking distance of some of the main sights - blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaar etc. The rooms are simple and cozy, and there is a great rooftop terrace with panoramic views across the bosphorous. We stayed here in November but the terrace was still a great place to hang out - loads of cosy cushions, heaters and blankets meant we could still sit and enjoy the view (and the free wireless) even when the rain was falling outside. Also, the breakfasts were amazing - a huge selection of good home-made Turkish food and pretty much all the tea and coffee you can drink, but what really makes this place is the staff. Kind, friendly and hospitable, they could not have been any more helpful - even helping me to get my computer fixed at short notice and showing us some great places to eat that we would never otherwise have found. I would most definitely recommend this place and would like to think that I'll get to come back again myself one day...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGeeSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel Ä±s well located wÄ±thÄ±n easy walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance of the Blue Mosque. The staff were wonderful, extremely helpful. The rooftop terrace Ä±s great and the breakfast Ä±s fantastÄ±cÃ§ we came back for tea durÄ±ng the afternoon and they offered us cake - fabulous after a hard days shoppÄ±ng Ä±n the Grand Bazar! The rooms are a lÄ±ttle small, but very comfortable. I would defÄ±nately recommend thÄ±s hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: hansCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sebneb this past summer for nine days My wife and I thought it was great. Location was perfect - you are within a short walking distance of most of the major attractions and the streets in the area are lined with good restaurants. The staff was friendly as where the people in the general vicinity of the hotel. It's not the easiest place to find and the rooms where small per American standards also no TV. If you are looking for luxury this isn't the place but we though it was great. Also you get a traditional Turkish breakfast every morning served on the balcony overlooking the Bosphorus strait. If you are looking for something luxurious the Four Seasons is about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but bleak & shabby room. Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is ideally situated in Sultanahmet and easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace with plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Being so close to such a vibrant area, there is some noise (even at the back of the hotel as the noise drifts across from other hotels adjoining the Sebnem). It is also only a short walk to the (efficient and very good value) public transport system (tram and metro, and a short tramride away â€“ the ferries) which we can highly recommend that you use â€“ Istanbul is a very big city! The staff at the Sebnem are a delight â€“ charming and helpful, and a credit to the hotel, particularly Fatih â€“ a very pleasant, amiable young man and the epitome of charm. We agree with other comments on TA that the breakfast is pretty good too, served on the attractive roof terrace (which has a covered area in bad weather â€“ yes, it DOES rain in Istanbul!). As with the rest of Istanbul, you have an attractive building next to a dilapidated one, and the position of the Sebnem is no different, but we would not say that this in any way detracted from the hotelâ€™s location. The hotel is very simply furnished. What we had expected from the photos and indeed from most of the posts on TA, was that the rooms would be furnished better than they turned out to be â€“ in say, the Riad fashion. A room can be simply, but stylishly furnished but we have to be honest and say that the Sebnem rooms (and common areas) the furnishings are pretty rudimentary and basic, the lighting poor and to be frank â€“ the whole room is pretty bleak and tatty. (We could see that other rooms are similarly furnished when we glanced in when they were being cleaned). We stayed in the Garden Room (203), which was a further disappointment. The room itself is small and the â€˜gardenâ€™ is an outside patio at back of the room (and back of the hotel), with some seating. From this patio, the only view is of neighbouring hotels fire escapes. Two rooms share this patio, gaining access from a back door in the room â€“ being rooms 203 and 202. (This might prove a problem if the occupants of the neighbouring room decide to make use of the patio late at night.) Our bathroom was modern and clean, there was plenty of hot water and the towels were changed daily. However, most hotels provide shower gel and shampoo â€“ note the Sebnem only provides their guests with soap â€“ a tad stingy we thought! For location, the lovely roof terrace especially the staff - the hotel is great â€“ BUT â€¦â€¦..We paid â‚¬100 per night (incl breakfast) â€“ and we believe that to charge this price, the rooms need a thorough overhaul and upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: cara38
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Istanbul I can recommend this perfect little Hotel as a place to stay. The hotel is in a great position - within easy walking distance of all the sights. the rate was 80 euro a night and breakfast is included. The Hotel has a roof deck area with stunning views across the sea - a great place to have a relaxing drink or take breakfast in the morning. Breakfast deserves special mention - prepared 'in house' the selection of fruits, cheeses, pastries etc. was sensational. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are basic but clean. We loved our stay at Sebnem and would have no hesitation returning.

Reviews.Title: “Small town charm Ä±n the bÄ±g cÄ±ty of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sonjalopez
Reviews.Content: Nestled behÄ±nd the Aya SofÄ±a and the Blue Mosque, the Sebnam Hotel Ä±s perfecly located Ä±n an area of Sultanahmet walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance from all the top hÄ±storÄ±c attractÄ±ons and a varÄ±ety of restaurants, bars, and gÄ±ft shops. The large rooms have all the modern convÄ±ences wÄ±th a tasteful Ottoman style decor. The rooftop terrace has panoramÄ±c vÄ±ew of the Golden Horn and durÄ±ng my trÄ±p, a front row seat to the fÄ±reworks show on CumhurÄ±yet, the celebratÄ±on of the formatÄ±on of the TurkÄ±sh RepublÄ±c. A breakfast of TurkÄ±sh and Ä±nternatÄ±onal specÄ±altÄ±es Ä±ncludÄ±ng any beverage you desÄ±re Ä±s served daÄ±ly on the rooftop terrace. From the lÄ±brary of books on Turkey, the Sony laptops wÄ±th wÄ±reless Ä±nternet, to the arrangement of any of your travel needs, there Ä±s nothÄ±ng that the staff at the Sebnem Hotel wÄ±ll not do to make theÄ±r guest feel at home at both theÄ±r hotel and Ä±n Istanbul. Sebnem Hotel deserves a gold star for Ä±ts efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: santelmo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in quiet position but in walking distance of most sights. Staff were good nothing to much trouble,we wanted to book train tickets ,they did this for us.we booked a standard room but were given a garden room at no extra cost.very good breakfast lots of choice in fact we had enough to make up a lunch picnic to take out with us during the day. great views from the terrace ,free internet and lots of guide books to borrow.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: tarajames
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Sebnem recently, and we would highly recommend it. The staff spoke excellent english, were knowledgable, helpful and friendly. The rooms are simple but comfortable, with modern bathrooms. The shower was one of the best I have ever had. But the real winner at Sebnem is the delicious breakfasts served buffet sytle every morning on the glorious rooftop patio. Amazing view and absolutley delicious breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: shinyboy
Reviews.Content: Gil and Fay, Poole, England. Stayed four nights at Sebnem last week Oct 2008. Had a great time. Warm welcome from Unal and the other staff. Very efficient and welcoming. Great location just minutes walk from Ayia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. You can see the minarets from the rooftop where we had really good breakfasts. All you can eat and more. Rooms are good and everything worked. Just around the corner are plenty of restaurants and bars. Istanbul was fascinating. Vibrant and hospitable people,even the carpet sellers! We plan to go back next year as we did not see all we wanted. We will be staying at Sebnem again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimsack
Reviews.Content: I miss the breakfast at Sebnem. So many tasty little treats to enjoy, tasty coffees or teas to sip, consistently thoughtful service, comfortable seating and other guests from around the world open to conversation and exchanging thoughts on Istanbul and the surrounding area. The Sebnem enjoys a great location near a fun pedestrian street, is easy walk to major Istanbul attractions and is staffed by very nice, capable and friendly staff members. Despite the central location in Sultanahmet there is very little noise, except for the early morning call to prayer, which can take one a bit by surprise the first morning. My drill sergeant was about as subtle. The price was very good, the rooms were small but comfortable and clean, the view from the third floor toward the Bosphorus and Asia was romantic at least and inspiring at best. I do not have any trouble recommending the Sebnem to people who wish a well located hotel at sensible prices. Oh, did I mention the excellent music in the dining area, and the cappuccino and the free internet and, again, the capable and friendly staff. They were the best and made our visit so much easier and more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: baclavaknights
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very comfortable and with a very nice atmosphere. The common spaces are very clean and comfortable. The roof terrace has great views over the Bosphorus. The breakfast is superb and has a much greater variety than should be expected. The location is great and only minutes from the main sites, bars and restaurants of Sultanhamet. The hotel staff are excellent. They were very friendly and welcoming and always willing to provide advice and support. This review really does not do Sebnem Hotel justice, it is one of the best hotels that we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: piglet484
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect spot for seeing all the major Istanbul sights. The hotel was cute and welcoming. We had a great room with a little courtyard/garden with patio lights and a small fountain, which we loved! In the morning, we went up to the terrace for breakfast buffet, which is included in the price of the room. The breakfast was delicious and the terrace was beautiful! If you really want to explore all of Istanbul, for instance Taksim square and Istiklal Cadessi, you'll need to take a taxi. But for first-time Istanbul visitor this is the perfect place to stay. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, and easy access to the bazaars by foot or by the tram. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back !”
Reviews.Author: Twigandbeef
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sebnem and cannot fault anything about this lovely, cozy and ultra-friendly hotel ! The location is great, near all the attractions, bars , restaurants etc and the hotel itself is small , quiet and tucked away in a cul-de-sac with no traffic. We had a garden room opening out onto a small patio with a fountain which was a lovely peaceful oasis to come back to after a hectic day. The roof terrace was also great for chilling out and meeting fellow travellers, with the added bonus of great views and friendly staff who seemed to be on hand at all hours , always with a friendly smile ;0) The breakfasts were awesome, with a massive variety of fruit, pastries, cheeses etc - heaven !! The hotel also organised our airport transfers, which were faultless, even though our 'plane was very late arriving . All in all our stay was perfect and will definitely be coming back !! Thank you to everyone at the Sebnem for making it a great holiday !! Carol & Dave.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and you are made to feel like family here”
Reviews.Author: yoribe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sebnem is located on a quiet, hilly cul-de-sac off of Akbiyik Sokak in a safe, tourist-friendly neighborhood of hotels and small handmade crafts shops where you can go for a quiet, late night drink of chai or beer. The location in Sultanahmet is ideal, as it is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Underground Cistern, and the Grand Bazaar. The whole atmosphere of this hotel was relaxed and inviting, as there are no big groups of tourists milling about in the lobby as in other larger hotels. I was immediately treated like family here by the proprietors and enjoyed their company. My hardwood-floored room had plenty of character with a drape over the bed and wooden furnishings. There were no TVs in the rooms, which is a plus for me since I believe it contributes to the quiet of the hotel. Breakfast was generous and helped give me energy for a long day of sightseeing, and the view of the Bosporus from the terrace while eating breakfast is a great way to start the day. I also appreciated the free use of the Internet in the lobby and in the terrace. The only complaints I have are with a broken soap holder in the shower stall and with a faulty window latch mechanism. I was impressed with Istanbul overall and shall definitely return to the Sebnem next time around! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Small Boutique Hotel Near Major Sites”
Reviews.Author: rede2g0
Reviews.Content: Our room had a Turkish canopy bed & decor. It opened to a small Ottoman style garden complete with chaise, small sofa and Turkish lanterns (we loved the lanterns!) Istanbul is very busy and so we loved relaxing out in our garden for happy hour each night to get away from the hectic pace of the city for a while. I have to say that the bathroom was ultra modern with plenty of hot water which can be a challenge with Turkey's solar heating. The air conditioning worked well and was a must. My favorite thing was the hotels large rooftop terrace with a view of the sea. The breakfast was the best! We spent 25 days in Turkey and we had a lot to compare it to! Nothing came close! Every morning there were at least seven types of breads/cakes, + banana crepes (yummy), a meat/cheese section, veggies, fruit, nuts & on and on.. Something for everyone & lots of choices and variety. They served four different types of juices + coffee and tea. The best thing about it was that they served Turkish specialties such as borek, spinach pie, eggplant salad etc and so we had the chance to try many dishes without having to pay for them at a restaurant. We looked forward to seeing what they would cook up each day! The breakfast alone would cost 12 YTL + elsewhere. Also, the hotel is right around the corner from Cheers Bar and several others. The street is quaint & is lined with shops, bars and restaurants. It is a low key night life spot for the area. The point is that you don't have to go far to be able to sit in an outdoor cafe or pub, watch people and enjoy some nightlife at very reasonable prices which seems rare for Sultanahmet. Summary: We loved the Sebnem, its location, food and friendly staff. They really care about you and want you to have an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Easy stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Adria051
Reviews.Content: We had a girly weekend in Istanbul and not enough time to go through the trouble of organizing everything ourselves. The staff at Sebnem was great, organizing the transfers to/from airport for us and even to a restaurant of our choice. The breakfast bar is overflowing with goodies, an my particular favourite, nice, ripe figs! The staff is very polite, friendly and keen to help. But if you are croatian like me, they will rub in the fact that they won the football match in the latest euro cup! ... :-)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: peregrina707
Reviews.Content: It starts with the people -- everyone working at Hotel Sebnem is wonderfully helpful, genuinely friendly, and anxious to make your visit to Istanbul memorable. My special thanks to Unal, at the front desk, who manages reservations (and I suspect everything else) and will help you find whatever it is you are looking for, always with a smile and always asking for feedback to make sure his recommendations are on target. I never felt like a "tourist" or a "customer" -- although I was both -- I felt like a guest and a friend. The rooms are spotless and charming; the entire property is in excellent condition and well maintained. The rooftop deck (stunning view of Beyoglu, the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmarra) offers a huge, homemade, delicious breakfast buffet in the morning and is a wonderful spot for end of day drinks or a chance to check your email on the laptops provided at no charge. The location - 5 minutes walk to the major attractions - and near lots of pleasant restaurants and hangouts feels low key and relaxing, very welcome after a long day of sightseeing among the throngs. I stayed at quite a few nice places during my 3 week trip around Turkey and Hotel Sebnem is my favorite, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: bnally
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a long weekend at the Sebnem, we can honestly say that the hotel and the staff lived up to all the previous fantastic reviews that we had read. Nothing was too much trouble. We had arranged with Unal to be collected and returned to the airport. The weather was'nt that great but it was lovely to return at night to find that the heating had been turned on or to be escorted out to a waiting taxi with an umbrella. The rooms were tidy and very clean, great shower, comfortable bed and quiet. Breakfast was from 8-11, so no hurrying just chill and relax. We asked for a tour guide for one morning and Unal arranged it all for us. Soner from aussie travel escorted us by foot and car, and took us to the usual attractions (and fast-tracked us through the crowds which was great) but also to some lesser known historical buildings which gave you a feel of the real Turkey and what life was like for the less fortunate. He also arranged for us to purchase some fish at the market and then take it to a restaurant to be cooked, this is something we would not have been able to do without him. Really enjoyed the day, great guy. I could go on forever about how fantastic everyone and everything is, but there is not enough room, so you will just have to go to Istanbul, stay at the Sebnem and find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Sebnem In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VGRUGS
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel charming and the hotel staff fully accomodating and friendly. Making a reservation was a snap....we emailed bacfk and forth until we found available dates that would work for us. Responses were quick...the English excellent. Absolutely confidence inspiring for a first time traveler to Turkey. The breakfast served was FABULOUS! Lots of variety...and way beyond the standard fare offered by most place. It was absolutely the best we had in all of our two week stay in 8 different hotels or pensyons. AND THEY SERVED COFFEE!!!!!!! Not that awful instant stuff. The room was spacious and decorated with taste. THe bathroom was immaculate. The water view from the roof top dining area was spectacular. All in all.....A PLUS....

Reviews.Title: “Songs of Praise”
Reviews.Author: LoveofTravelToronto
Reviews.Content: I am a 22 year old female who visited Hotel Sebnem with my brother (25) for our week long stay in Istanbul. It was our first trip to Turkey and our expectations were very high as we both love to travel. Upon arrival, we were absolutely stunned by the terrace views and dramatic look of the terrace. The man who works at the front desk Umal (spelling?) was notably professional, yet warm and obviously extremely hardworking. My brother and I were both very impressed with his knowledge of the city and ability to answer all of our questions. I think it is also important to mention, that as a female traveller, there were days when I was not with my brother and I can say that I felt completely comfortable and safe around the entire staff as they were all very polite and the kind of people that one would want to be friends with. The breakfast was amazing and about 20 times better than any breakfast I have ever made for myself and the other guy on the terrace from Georgia whose name if I tried to spell - I know would be shameful, was incredibly polite and obviously very eager to help out all the guests and attend to their needs. The rooms had air conditioners, which was wonderful, and I am probably the pickiest person in the world when it comes to tidy hotel rooms and this hotel was VERY clean. Before I sleep in any bed I check the sheets and take a quick scan to make sure there are no bugs or weird things and this place probably had the cleanest sheets I have seen in a hotel in a very long time. The bathroom was spotless and they changed the garbage every day. Whoever cleaned our room even picked up my pyjamas off the floor and folded them - it was really sweet. It felt like at the end of a long day, we were coming home. In general, I give Hotel Sebnem a rave review. My brother and I both think that the man at the front desk and the man on the terrace deserve raises because they continuously work so hard, and the entire staff should be commended for their dedication and warmth into making that hotel a success. I highly suggest it to anyone and in terms of prices in Istanbul, the location and breakfast alone make staying at this hotel well worth it, you definitely get the most for your money here. All in all, people should stay there! Alena Marshall (University of Toronto, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Easy access by metro, free Internet.”
Reviews.Author: Otto_Partz
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive reviews. They are all so positive I almost feel compelled to say something negative but the worst thing I can say is I didn't love the coffee. They have free wi-fi and two or three computers guests can use. A street address won't help you find it so be sure to bring the map or directions the Web site will provide. If you're arriving at the Ataturk Airport, it's easy to get to by metro. The Web site TurkeyTravelPlanner.com provides foolproof details for the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sebnem!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNamaste
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Turkey that concluded with a 4-night stay at Sebnem. We cannot say enough positive things about this property. The staff are outstanding...competent, friendly, kind, and helpful...not to mention that they speak multiple languages fluently. Requests for services (e.g. shuttle transfers, directions, how to buy a ticket to the ferry) were handled without issue or problem. The property itself is in a no-through-traffic side street in Sultanahmet, just down the hill from the Four Seasons. This means easy walking distance to all of the Sultanahmet sites, plus we found it convenient to walk to Eminonu (ferry terminals, Galata bridge, Spice Bazaar) as well. The rooms are small but tidy, well-maintained, and good value for money in Sultanahmet. The bathroom in particular was quite modern, clean, and nicely appointed. All guests have full access to the terrace, which is a delightful spot overlooking the Sea of Marmara. There are also 3 notebooks for internet access, which we found very convenient, and the staff are almost always there to bring a cup of cay and a kind word of welcome. Also, having had fairly meager Turkish breakfast at other hotels, we were delighted at the spread at Sebnem, which included many different kinds of breads, meats, and cheeses in addition to a wide variety of fruit, jam, and marmalade. We were very pleased with our stay at Sebnem, and recommend it highly to anyone spending time in Istanbul. But reserve early! More than one fellow resident found themselves wanting to extend their stay at Sebnem but unable to do so because there were no vacancies (this was high season, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, very good location”
Reviews.Author: philorock
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. our room was a bit small, and lighting not so bright, but bed was very comfortable and shower was great. very nice location, a block from excellent restaurants and easy walk to topkapi palace and blue mosque. short tram ride to spice market and ferries. food was superb in rooftop garden with excellent view. staff couldn't be more helpful and accomodating. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: Excellent roof top panorama, I spent hours there relaxing, reading. Very friendly and relaxed atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff. Small and intimate hotel. The room I had was a bit run down, although equipped with a nice selection of wooden furniture. Clean and pleasant, but no particular luxury (just what I wanted). All in all the hotel was well kept. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: chipchip
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and service. Best value in Istanbul My husband and I stayed on 2 stays during Turkey travel. All of the staff were amazingly helpfu, friendly and welcoming. They went out of their way for us in a way that we have never experienced anywhere. There ia a fabulous rooftop terrace with comfortable furniture, and a cool breeze from teh sea. It is so convenient to have access to the laptop computers provided with internet service. Comfortable bed, ask for room at the back for quiet. Breakfast also is excellent. I will send all of my friends here and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: v0yageuse2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon in Istanbul, and paid 90 euros a night for a double-room in high-season. Things we enjoyed about the hotel: -First and foremost, the deck. The couches and chairs are extremely comfortable, and it was a great place to lounge around for a week. The view is of the sea only-- no momuments-- and while I didn't find it breathtaking per se it was certainly very calm and pretty. I did not see any slums as other commenters have noted. -The breakfast. Really, really wonderful-- fresh fruit (watermelon, fruit salad, kiwis, bananas, etc), a variety of cakes, several juices (not fresh, alas), and many salty foods as well (hardboiled eggs, cheeses, meats, etc). We always looked forward to breakfast, unlike in many hotels where it can be a rather disappointing or even disgusting start to the day. - The laid-back staff. They are not obsequious as other Istanbul hoteliers can be ("Yes please! Come in!") Helpful when asked, and always quick to take care of problems. -The furnishings in the room. Very simple and understated, but old-fashioned and elegant: four-poster canopy bed, framed engravings of old Istanbul, a little writing desk. -The location. Yes, most hotels are in Sultanhamet so it's not that special to be in walking distance of all the tourist sites. Sebnem, however, is located on a quiet sidestreet that, while only a stone's throw from the major artery of tourist bars and restaurants, remained very calm and peaceful. -The shower was very nice, very good pressure. -Two laptops were put out on the deck for communal use. The internet was often out of order, but it was still a nice touch. Things we didn't like so much: -As others have mentioned, there was an unpleasant smell in the bathroom. Someone said it smelled musty; I thought it was like rotten cabbage. Either way, yuck. -The bathroom was very small and had low lighting. -Things were looking a little worse for wear in the bedroom: there were holes in the sheets and canopy bed covering, the paint was chipped in places on the walls, our curtains fell down two or three times, the furniture was very scuffed up, and the bed coverings were threadbare and not very comfortable. -It would have been nice to have had a room service option during the day, although I'm glad there was no on-site restaurant (the deck was all to ourselves that way!) In short, I would definitely recommend this hotel and we had a really great stay in spite of a few nitpicky criticisms. In any other city (including all of the European capitals) I have never paid 90 euros a night but the Euro (or Lira) doesn't stretch very far in Istanbul and compared to other hotels it was in the same range. Anyway, it was worth the money for a stress-free stay. No regrets-- only fond memories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: LoraDora
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel in the heart of the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul within walking distance to most major sites including the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Grand Bazaar. The owner is helpful and a genuinely nice person. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms are brand new! Rooms are small, but that is expected in Europe. A lovely roof top terrace is a nice place to relax and enjoy the view of the Sea of Marmara. Laptop computers with Internet connections are available to guests. The Turkish buffet breakfast is wonderful with lots of fresh fruit, cheeses, meats, olives, and pastries. Good value for the lire.

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem rocks!”
Reviews.Author: NYCArchivist
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Unal and everyone at Sebnem (and at Backpackers too) for a fabulous stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “what a place!”
Reviews.Author: Caius27
Reviews.Content: two things are to mention before all: the wonderful roof terrace and the extremely relaxed and friendly staff. sebnem hotel is an oasis in the rush of an exciting city. perfect location in sultanahmed (5 min walk to hagia sofia, blue mosque and topcapi palace; plenty of restaurants and bars just around the corner). the reakfast is wonderful, too. rooms are o.k. but don't expect too much (at least for the cheaper rooms we stayed in). anyway: absolutely to recommend for a pleasant stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: Kilsherry
Reviews.Content: Istanbul: Sebnem Hotel: Great place to stay Date: 28 May 2008 Reviewer: Australian couple with adult son We have just returned from a trip to Turkey and were a bit apprehensive about finding a nice hotel in Istanbul within our price range. After reading lots of positive reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked into the Sebnem Hotel. The Sebnem Hotel far exceeded our expectations. It was in an excellent location, in Sultanahmet. It was situated in a quiet area, yet was within a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. It had a lovely rooftop terrace where an excellent breakfast was served overlooking the Bosphorus. On the terrace were 2 laptop computers with internet connection which were available for use free of charge 24 hours a day. The rooms were very nice, with modern bathrooms and were spotlessly clean. There were no TVs in the rooms, but this did not worry us as we don't travel overseas to watch TV. I would like to make a special mention of the man at the front desk. He was very friendly and helpful. He was always happy to give advice on things to see and how to get there and he even organised a lovely 3 day trip for us to Gallipoli, Troy and Ephesus, including travel, accommodation and guided tours. Everything went like clockwork. If we ever get back to Istanbul, we will certainly stay at the Sebnem Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy nights in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Tango01
Reviews.Content: Advantages: -Accesible room rates. -Clean and cosy. -Gorgeous terrase. Wonderful view. -Nice european/turkish breakfast. -Hotel location is priceless! Near main turistic spots. -Kind and polite staff. -Airport pick up service (would recommend it). Disadvantages: -Near a crowded street packed with restaurants and close to the youth hostel. Could get quite noisy during night (take a pair of earplugs). -If you stay for quite a long time you must remind the cleaning service to change your blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: desbara
Reviews.Content: What a little gem! As other reviewers wrote before - perfect location, great terrace with fab views, friendly staff! Had a fantastic time and I would recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: GirdleTheEarth
Reviews.Content: We booked this wonderful hotel on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The Sebnem Hotel is ideally located for a visit to Istanbul. It is a few minutes walk from all the major sights of the Sultanahmet area, such as Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and it is within easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazar, and Eminonu, where you catch the ferry for the Bosphorus trip. In fact we walked further afield and it's a good way of getting the feel of the city. As for the hotel itself, it is quite delightful. We travelled with my brother and his wife and had two rooms on the ground floor that had private access to a charming patio, complete with a profusion of plants, a small fountain and a bench to sit on. Both rooms had an exotic canopy above the bed which gave a very romantic feel to the rooms. The showers were brand new, with two swivelling shower heads, and on the adjacent wall a heated towel rail to dry both the towels and any washing. The rooms were beautifully serviced each day and it was a pleasure to come back to them. The entrance to the hotel is very inviting, with lots of plants outside, and inside a very 'Ottoman' look. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, arranging our hotel in Ephesus, where we were heading after Istanbul, and car hire for the journey. The crowning glory of the hotel is the roof terrace where breakfast is served. This has a beautiful view of the Bosphorus and it was hard to drag ourselves away each morning to do any sight-seeing! Part of it is under cover for inclement weather, although happily we didn't have to make use of it. The breakfast is included in the room rate and is excellent. Having become accustomed to the typical Turkish breakfast of hard boiled eggs, tomatoes cucumbers, olives, cheese, bread, jam and honey on the southern coast of Turkey, we felt ourselves really pampered to have in addition lots of fresh fruit, breakfast cereal, yoghourt, several types of pastries both savoury and sweet, and for an extra 2 lira, pomegranate or orange juice freshly squeezed before your eyes. And all this was while sitting on the most comfortable benches and chairs, covered with huge and luxurious cushions. We shall definitely return to this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super location! Great views!”
Reviews.Author: Morsell
Reviews.Content: What a great place to base our Istanbul activities! The room was comfortable, with a nicely renovated bathroom and air conditioning. The terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara is the best feature, when coupled with the delicious breakfast. We loved the variety of food and beverages...especially chocolate cake for breakfast! The staff is very helpful and accommodating, although a few don't speak much English. This was never a problem, though, and we always had just what we needed. There are several stations to check email and grab tea, which came in handy for setting up future expeditions. One downside was the noise at night. Earplugs were a must for our room at the front of the hotel. The hotel is near several youth hostels and other hotels, in addition to being just off a main thoroughfare. Despite this, Sebnem is a wonderful choice and we were truly pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: yeepeeyeepeeyeah
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Istanbul: everythÄ±ng is superbe,the people,the rooms and the stunning vÄ±ew on the sea. Breakfast on the terrasse is a must!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: GallusMagnus
Reviews.Content: This is a small, charming hotel in a great location with terrific staff. Budget pricing with luxury grade service. The hotel staff - especially Unal - went out of their way to accommodate us. For example, our weary, bedraggled family were given a room in which to rest after an early morning arrival way before official check-in time. They made phone calls on our behalf, without charge, and added taxi bills conveniently to our hotel charges. The "family room" (double + two singles) was very clean and comfortably housed the four of us. Great shower (two shower heads!) and we even got bathroom slippers - to keep! The location is absolutely perfect for sightseeing on foot (Cistern, Blue Mosque, Ayasofya and Topkapi). We were just a block away from the Four Seasons which you can be sure is triple the price. Breakfast (included) was simple but tasty. The library was well stocked with travel books, and three laptops with internet connection were available in the public areas. Plus free, speedy wi-fi internet in the rooms! The spectacular rooftop terrace view over the water and the city will long stay in the memory, along with the early morning wake-up call from the muezzin at Ayasofya. Our only regret is that our stay was too short. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: 78704tunate
Reviews.Content: The Sebnem Hotel is a delightful retreat close to the city center of Istanbul. Although it is located in a fairly touristy area, the hotel is on the edge of the neighborhood, within earshot of shipsâ€™ horns on the Sea of Marmara and the call to prayer of a few different mosques. The rooftop terrace is exceptional, offering an outstanding view â€“ not to mention an amazing breakfast. The staff at the Sebnem is top-notch, offering advice on parts of the city not to be missed, as well as helpful information that will add a unique dimension to your stay. I did lots of research before heading to Turkey, and I was pleased to find the Sebnem more than lived up to its reviews. When I next return to Istanbul, I wonâ€™t stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wish all hotels were like this”
Reviews.Author: markorcarol
Reviews.Content: This place was not only a great value for the money in a superb location, the hospitality was unbeatable. When my husband's wallet was stolen they didn't hesitate to provide the resources we needed to cancel our credit and debit cards. They even offered to loan us money, which wasn't necessary. However, no chain hotel would offer that kind of trust and kindness. The room was well-appointed -- on the small side, but sparkling clean with a modern bathroom. The rooftop deck was the highlight, with a tremendous view of the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara. You could stay there just for the breakfast. It was a great spread. Stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: priscillaBath
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem in Sultanamet. charming room with four poster bed and pristine shower room. good breakfast on the roof terrace which can br used throughout the day for coffee and internet,and ,best of all ,wonderful staff.Unal,in particular was constantly available for help with travel in the city etc and welcoming to my family who visited most days.Looking forward to our next stay .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: RG11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sebnem for 4 nights in March 2008. It was an absolutely wonderful experience all through. The rooms were tidy and adequately spacious. The bathrooms were also very clean and functional. The location was absolutely marvelous - a two minute walk from all the major sights in Sultanahmet, but off the main thoroughfare and therefore peaceful. The rooftop terrace was very charming and had great views of the Sea of Marmara. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Unal, the manager, was an absolute godsend and was at the desk 24 ours for all the four nights that we were there! He helped us with bus tickets for travel within Turkey and was always around to give us directions and other advice on where to visit. He even helped book us a room at another hotel when we decided to return to Istanbul a night early and Sebnem was full up. We also availed of the airport pick up service which went off without a hitch. We wholeheartedly recommend this hotel! R.G and E.R U.S.A

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but certainly not great”
Reviews.Author: Chopsy1
Reviews.Content: On the basis of the reviews I had read I was looking forward to our stay at Sebnem. While we were satisfied with our stay, the standard we experienced was nothing like described in most of the reviews I read. The rooms are serviceable, though not as nice as they appear on the website. The staff were largely disinterested - we didn't find them to be particularly helpful. It was also quite frustrating that one staff member kept bugging us to come and buy things from his souvenir shop. On the streets of Istanbul you encounter a constant deluge of people trying to sell you things. I don't have a problem with this, and believe it is an important part of Istanbul's character. However, I don't expect to have to encounter this in the accommodation I am staying in. However, our biggest gripe is that our room did not get serviced the whole time we were staying there (7 nights). On a couple of occasions we had to find our own rolls of toilet paper in a cupboard in the hallway when we ran out. I am by no means a clean freak, but this really wasn't good enough over a 7 day period. There were nevertheless a number of positives. The breakfast each day and the rooftop terrace were very nice, and the location was also good. However, overall given that there are a lot of accommodation places in this area of Istanbul I would not stay here again and would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sebnem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Senka30
Reviews.Content: We have spend 5 days in March in Sebnem Hotel in triple room. Location is perfect, just a minut walk to Aja Sofija!Nice neighborhood.Very friendly staff.Simple, clean and charming hotel.Very good beds and clean bathrooms.Breakfast is good and more then enough. Next time in Istanbul we will go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sebnem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cyril-K
Reviews.Content: In front of the Black sea, in 1 min to Sulthanamet Camii and Aya Sofyia! A perfect place to be for your hollyday in Istanbul! The rooms are small but verry cute, with a good bed, and the bathroom/toilets are clean. For breakfast you have on the roof, a perfect place, very peacefull, with a perfect view on the Asian side. Every day the staff takes care to clean the room perfectly, the manager is really nice, always ready to help for any question : travel boat, bosphore, or other stuffs.
