A computer can be use at any time with internet freely. If you need to go outside Istanbul few days, you can let your logages at the hotel without any problem! The price in winter time -out season- are less than 40â‚¬. Have a nice trip at The Sebnem Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: indiraOxford
Reviews.Content: 4 of us have just spent 3nights in the wonderfull city of Istanbul. We stayed at the excellent Sebnum Hotel-where we received a very warm welcome from Tahir. The rooms were clean ,breakfast delicious-(especially the fresh bread rolls),and the atmosphere relaxed. The view from the rooftop terrace where breakfast was served is superb.It would be great to return during warmer months when the terrace is open to the sunshine. The Sebnum is ideally situated near all the main attractions-we walked everywhere. Tahir organised airport transfers for us-this went without a hitch. We all agreed that we would return to the Sebnum in the future. Jeff-Oxfordshire

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: Femminafilms
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Sebnem. Tahir and Unal were wonderful hosts and very helpful in directing us around the city and giving suggestions on what to see and where to eat. I'd highly recommend the Sebnem to anyone looking for great location and great price. It's just 5mins to all the big sites and there are so many great restaurants and pubs just around the corner from the hotel. I look forward to going back sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Sebnem Super Friendly & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Chasconita
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Sebnem for about a week this past December and had a fantastic experience. As other reviewers have noted, the location is perfect for exploring the main attractions of Istanbul's historic districts, and Unal and Tahir were super helpful and laid back. We really appreciated their friendly suggestions for getting around the city and making the most of our trip. Our room was tidy, comfortable and quiet, with a view of a lovely fig tree. Breakfast on the terrace was a treat every morning and learning to play backgammon with Tahir in the evening almost had us feeling like locals ~ We had to move across the street to another guest house for a couple of days around New Year's because Sebnem was booked up... Even though the room there was a tad larger and more finely finished, we really missed the warmth and hospitality of Sebnem... so we ended up spending our free time back over there, nonetheless. A stay at Sebnem will be a highlight of your trip! Oh! And we asked Tahir and Unal what "Sebnem" means... it means "dew".

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Aerocalexico
Reviews.Content: Good mid-range hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Room wasn't huge but was perfectly serviceable and the location is perfect for exploring the city. Good roof terrace too!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Berlin21
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice budget hotel in Sultanahmet. he rooms are clean and fairly-priced. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and helpful. When I confused the dates of our arrival, they did not charge us for the extra night, and they worked out a great solution when we needed a room again for a couple of hours at the end of our trip to Turkey. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: entropy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sebnem for 3 nights in the beginning of October. Some positives: excellent location (very close to the Blue Mosque and the tram station), wonderful terrace with a gorgeous view and a good selection of items for breakfast. However, we didn't find that the rooms were anything special. The bathrooms were small (ever compared to places like NYC and London) and a bit dingy, and the rooms seemed a bit dated - certainly looked no where as charming as they appeared on the hotel's website. Nevertheless, given the price and location, I would recommend this hotel - just know that you get what you pay for. Oh 1 more note - it's not worth it to get a "garden room", the hotel doesn't actually have a garden, so I'd just stick with the regular rooms.

Reviews.Title: “beautÄ±ful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sebnem Ä±s a wonderful place to stay: it has small but very tastefully furnished rooms, a breakfast roofterrace wÄ±th a superbe view on the sea, very friendly and helpfull owners and it is located in the old part of Istanbul. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Aya Sophia and the TopkapÄ± Palace! We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Sebnem”
Reviews.Author: FangXmetro
Reviews.Content: Moderate rates, great location for travelers (near the Four Seasons). The staff can help with directions, book tours and even hook you up with a carpet salesman. They have an airport car service, very helpful for first time visitors. Great rooftop terrace. Send them an email to book your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my reservation”
Reviews.Author: lalka624
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation for an ocean view hotel room at Hotel Sebnem via e-mail approximately 8 weeks in advance of our stay. Upon arrival on the day of our reservation (early in the morning) the man at the front desk stated he had "upgraded" our reservation to a hotel around the corner. I told him I didn't know anything about that hotel and I had booked the reservation there. He said he had no rooms available. I asked if he had rooms available when I made the reservations and he said yes. He didn't offer an apology or anything and never e-mailed me prior to our arrival to let us know he was overbooked. So not knowing where else to go, we followed him around the corner to the Star hotel. This was certainly not an upgrade and even cost less than the other hotel. There was no ocean view, the view was of some falling down building. The lady at the front desk was very nice but this was just not the hotel we booked. To top it all off, we saw at least 10 roaches in our room. We told the lady this and she said she would put down a roach trap, which I then noticed were in all of the hallways. Disgusting. I slept with the lights on because when we turned the lights off, they would come out.
